jobDescription:
Interested in taking your career to the next level driving the market success of a strategic priority for Oracle in Cloud?
Why this roleDedicated Region Cloud@Customer is Oracle’s strategic offering for a managed private cloud/distributed cloud i.e. OCI commercial region dedicated to a single customer deployed in their datacentre. To drive market success of this offering, we are investing in building a team of highly talented individuals in Asia Pacific.
What You'll DoYou will own & drive OCI-Dedicated Region opportunities from inception to close, working closely with the in-region Geo Managing Directors, Cloud Sales Leaders and Key Account Leaders.Manage all aspects of opportunity lifecycle and orchestrate the alignment of key resources at the relevant stages of the lifecycle.Support identification to qualification of opportunities. For qualified opportunities, lead the business case development (TCO models, workload identification- existing & new), solution architecture, commercial constructs- Overall proposition development and articulation.You will pitch the overall proposition at not only the customer CXO level (CEO, COO etc) but also at technical level (Architect teams, Infrastructure teams etc).Pull all stops from the sale.
Who You'll Work WithPrimarily with our customers but working with extended teams internally is very vital for this role. You will work extensively with Insight, TCE, Industry Architects, Cloud Pursuit & OCI Product management teams.
Who You AreIf you enjoy taking on challenges in Technical-Business Development & exploring unchartered territories, this role is for you.
To be successful in this role, you will need a strong background in Datacentre transformation/Hyperconverged Infrastructure/Private Cloud/Large cloud migrations in a presales or an implementer role. Strong understanding of OCI (Oracle Cloud Infrastructure) or other cloud hyperscaler is a must. Experience in Distributed Cloud (AWS Outpost, Azure Stack, GCP Anthos, Nutanix, Openshift) is preferred.You have over 15 years’ of rich experience having worked on multiple technologies, managed/implemented large deals or pursuits & become a trusted advisor to customers.You have witnessed the data centre evolution from converged infrastructure to hyper converged infrastructure to software defined datacentre. This experience will help pitch the value of OCI platform & software defined infrastructure when deployed in the customers’ datacenter.
You have experience migrating workloads to public clouds? This will help engage with customers and identify suitable workloads in the datacentre to migrate to OCI- Dedicated region.You have experience managing large deals & pitching to C-Level? This will help you lead & manage the OCI-Dedicated Region opportunity through the lifecycle that can span 2-4 quarters. Your experience pitching to C-Level will come handy articulating the overall OCI-Dedicated region proposition.
You have experience in Digital transformation initiatives? This will help you convince customers to leverage OCI- Dedicated region as a platform for innovation. This experience is desirable and not mandatory, you would know this terminology having managed responses to multiple RFI/RFPs.
You exude a strong technical aptitude, high motivation to develop new business & a positive attitude that is contagious. You are passionate in pursuit of success & building positive relationships with customers and colleagues. You possess strong business acumen to spot opportunities for OCI- Dedicated region where others see none. You are articulate & have phenomenal communication/presentation skills. You thrive in a team environment & have a flair bringing large teams together for a shared purpose. You enjoy sharing ideas and best practices.

Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.

Key ResponsibilitiesDeliver professional, timely and effective technical expertise on Systems technologiesAdopt best practices towards Systems Design and Build and deliver products to user community operable by IT Shared Services.Act as the 3rd level support to IT Shared Services infrastructure operations.Provide Systems related service support when escalated by partner teams towards Server incidents within a complex environment and developing a methodical approach to problem solving.Analyze recurring issues through root cause analysis as part of Problem ManagementImplement changes to infrastructure in accordance with change management process.Develop and maintain the Systems Standards .
Knowledge and SkillsAt least 8 to 10 years of experience working with Cloud Technologies (Azure and/or AWS), Microsoft, Citrix, VMware product family.Industry Technical Certifications is essential: Cloud, VMWare, MicrosoftWell versed in Azure and/or AWS, VMware vSphere/ESX, Citrix Xenapp, Storage Systems (EMC)Experienced in Microsoft Windows environment, MS Exchange, MS Active Directory (AD) and Group Policy (GPO)Experience in Microsoft System Centre Configuration Manager (SCCM) and Systems Centre Operations Manager (SCOM)Knowledge of Health & Security Industry IT Operations would be a strong benefit.

At foodpanda we're on a mission to redefine how tech, food, people and culture are connected operating in 12 countries worldwide. Operating in 12 countries, our team is working on big challenges and complex scalability problems processing millions of orders a year. You’ll be part of a highly collaborative cross-functional agile squad that always includes frontend and backend engineers, design, ux research, data analysts and product owners. Our squads operate in an open and fast-paced environment with very flat structures where everyone has a say.

Analytics Engineer - Consumer Product, APAC

We are looking for an Analytics Engineer  to join one of our consumer product tribes that builds and scales the digital experience enjoyed by millions of consumers across 7 brands in 40+ countries. Our users can do a lot on our platform—order food delivery, buy groceries, find dine-in deals, discover new ad offerings from our partners, play games in our loyalty program (and more!)—and our goal is to make all this as delightful, personalised and seamless an experience as possible !

As an Analytics Engineer embedded in our product analytics team, you will be building the data foundation for analysis and experimentation. The mandate of our team is simple & threefold: i) reliably and effectively track user behaviour at scale (talking terabytes of data here!), ii) enable a data-informed decision making culture (self-serve analytics, metrics & measurement strategy, controlled experimentation), and iii) drive generative research that informs & prioritises our product feature backlog.

The team is primarily split between Berlin and Singapore and is structured as cross-functional squads & tribes that focus on different aspects of our user experience.

What's On The Menu
 Optimise large-scale ingestion of backend and frontend events by having a hand in how our data capture processes are designed, developed, and maintained  Architect and build reliable, curated data models and associated production pipelines  Own the dbt + Airflow framework for product analytics  Partner with our Global Data Team to improve our experiment evaluation infrastructure  Champion quality data governance and querying through knowledge shares, workflow optimisations, hiring, onboarding of talent etc 
What You Can Bring To The Table
 2+ years of relevant analytics/data engineering experience (4+ for senior) in rapidly growing and dynamic environments  Experience with setting up ETL/ELT pipelines and workflow scheduling tools like dbt  Strong skills in schema design, dimensional data modeling, and SQL  Good written and verbal English communication skills  Nice-to-have: Familiarity with BigQuery and Google Cloud Platform as well as experimentation techniques 
Want to hear more about what we do? Here's an Introduction to foodpanda's analytics team

About Foodpanda

foodpanda (small ‘f’) is the world’s favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it’s getting your hands on your favourite pasta, kebab or pizza, we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again.

Our parent company, Delivery Hero, is a global leader in the food delivery industry processing over 3 million orders every day and operating in 40+ markets in the world, with 18,000 employees and approximately 500,000+ restaurant partners. In APAC, foodpanda operates in over 150 cities across 12 countries. Trivial problems can always become large technical challenges at scale. If you love technology, efficiency and simplicity as much as we do, there is no better place to experience this than in foodpanda.

We always genuinely care about experience, efficiency and scalability. We do not just solve technical problems but build the foundations for foodpanda’s operations with the best tools on hand.

Dell Technologies is a leader in providing technology infrastructure to its customers in an era increasingly being driven by digital and data. Enabling Dell to satisfy its customers’ needs hinges on executing a world class supply chain, connecting together sales orders with a complex ecosystem of partners and suppliers. Data plays an integral role in this as we digitize and modernize our supply chain. Join our Data Analytics & Automation team within Supply chain as a Senior/Data Scientist to solve our most challenging business problems with statistical, predictive and prescriptive approaches, making our decision making faster and more sophisticated. We offer a competitive remuneration package.

As part of Dell Technologies Global Operations Data Science team, you will…
Advance our supply chain modernization efforts by working closely with other Data, Analytics and Automation professionals and supply chain domain experts to understand complex business problems and co-create digital solutions driven by data science modelsSee your algorithms and solutions get scaled and deployed, while learning from your mistakesJoin and contribute to a community of data scientists by sharing industry best practices and lessons learnt from past and ongoing projectsIdentify opportunities to innovate across the supply chain through team challenges, to collaborations with external industry disruptorsCraft and execute a personalized development plan with your manager to ensure you will continuously grow in your career aspirations, whether it be technical leadership or people leadership

We seek data scientists with a passion to…
Deep dive into data to find answers to yet unknown questions and have a natural desire to go beneath the surface of a problemAsk and answer questions in large datasets and have a strong desire to create strategies and solutions that challenge and expand the thinking of everyone around youCollaborate in cross functional teams to co-create solutions to business problems, bringing a combination of data science expertise with business acumen to drive pragmatic, business driven value.Keeping abreast of latest developments in the field and identifies opportunities to apply within our organizationTrain/guide data science enthusiasts across the organization

Essential Requirements
Bachelor's / Master’s / PhD degree in a relevant field such as Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Data analytics or Data Sciences with 5 – 8+ years of experienceRelevant work experience applying data science/machine learning/statistical techniques to quantitative problems in a business environment, demonstrating ability to experiment, develop and deploy solutions into production environments.Expertise in building supervised/unsupervised solutions leveraging but not limited to regression, classification, clustering, time series forecasting & NLP techniques.Ability to optimize code for performance, scalability and readability.Strong communication skills with the ability to flex style to suit the audience, ranging from technical to non technical.

Highly desirable skills:
Experience working in distributed computing environments like Spark (PySpark and/or SparkR). Hands on experience with docker and other relevant CICD tools desirable but not required.

Our team’s way of working
We are uncovering ways to impact every key decision in Dell’s supply chain with a data science solution.We use our curiosity to find latent opportunities by experimenting together.We work in an agile methodology and have the autonomy to suggest and work on optimal approaches.We target decisions that achieve our company objectives. Our solutions address important prevailing business problems and we continuously keep this in mind while progressing through our projects.We excel when we collaborate. Data scientists are encouraged to seek feedback from others and have open discussions while progressing through the data science lifecycle.

Here’s our story; now tell us yours

Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.

jobDescription:
Oracle's Cloud is a new ground-up effort to build Infrastructure and Platform as a Service that operate at high scale in a broadly distributed multi-tenant cloud environment. Our customers run their businesses on our cloud, and our mission is to provide them with best in class compute, storage, networking, database, security, and an ever-expanding set of cloud-based services. 
Exadata Cloud Service is the premium database cloud service offering from Oracle. It allows you to leverage the power of Exadata in the cloud. We are looking for an experienced Cloud Ops Engineer with cloud service experience to join our Cloud operations team. For more information, please check https://www.oracle.com/engineered-systems/exadata/cloud-service/
The team is responsible for managing the Oracle's Exadata Cloud Service Fleet consisting of thousands of Exadata racks. You'll be part of a team of experts who build operate and maintain large fleet of Exadata racks. You will provide support for implementation, troubleshooting and maintenance of Exadata Infrastructure in the cloud. Responsibilities include managing Exadata system infrastructure and processes related to these systems including day-to-day operation, monitoring, troubleshooting and problem-resolution.
Core activities and responsibilitiesDesign, automate, deploy, and maintain Oracle Exadata Cloud Service and Exadata Cloud @ Customer SystemsWork collaboratively with development team to define infrastructure and deployment requirementsTroubleshoot systems and provide problem resolutionScript and automate any routine manual systems tasksBe available to participate in on call rotation

jobTitle: Manager - Cloud Solutions Architect_Financial Services - SG
jobDescription:
At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals. 

 Work you will do 

Cloud is transforming the way technology enables the business. It represents a radical shift in how IT services are obtained, used, and managed. Companies are navigating through the various cloud options and deciding between private, public, or a combination across different and dynamic provider ecosystems. Our cloud specialists guide our clients through multi-year journeys from the case for change through implementation across all dimensions of cloud - business alignment, technology architecture and design, cloud application on-boarding, and transforming their operating model – to help solve our client’s most complex issues with the focus on value creation.

Our practitioners work collaboratively within integrated, cross-functional teams to deliver comprehensive strategies that enable Cloud and Infrastructure transformations. Teamwork is crucial as teams are composed of a diverse group of specialists across multiple disciplines from both within our consulting practice and from our clients, helping drive towards a successful outcome. Our practitioners are expected to own and deliver their respective deliverables while managing different clients and other stakeholders.

In partnership with other leaders in the firm, you will focus on selling and delivering cloud solutions using AWS. As Cloud Architect, you will you will drive the design and delivery of world-class cloud solutions for our clients, providing expertise on cloud infrastructure services including design, build and migrate. This includes taking a lead role in the cloud architecture and engineering practice. You will be challenged to find approaches that enable rapid adoption of new cloud services and drive transformation for our client’s business and IT processes.
 Promote public cloud internally to sales and delivery teams to drive growth.  Be the go to person for Cloud Architecture. You should have a deep understanding of services offered on Public Cloud platforms and understand how to use them together to build complex solutions.  Educate customers of all sizes on the value proposition of Public Cloud and participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud  Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the public cloud solutions architect community  Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within customers to enable them to be cloud advocates  Act as a technical liaison between customers, delivery teams and support. 
 Your role as a leader 

At Deloitte, we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. We expect our people to embrace and live our purpose and shared values, challenging themselves every day to identify issues that are most important to our clients, our people and the communities, and to make an impact that matters. In addition to living our purpose, Managers across our Firm are expected to:
 Understand the goals of Deloitte, align our people to these objectives by setting clear priorities and direction by establishing a positive relationship with a senior stakeholders.  Influence teams and individuals positively. Lead by example and provide equal opportunity for people to grow, develop and succeed.  Delivers exceptional client service. Maximizes results and drives high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and geographies.  Manage diverse teams within a highly inclusive team culture where people are respected and valued for their contribution.  Develop high-performing teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities and recognize them for the impact that they make. 
Enough About Us, Let's Talk About You

If you are someone with:
 The right person will be detailed, highly technical, having a minimum of 8 years of current solution architecture experience, including consulting and implementation for hybrid, and non-hybrid solutions. Demonstrated experience in an enterprise environment, and experience with AWS is an advantage  The candidate is AWS Certified (at least Solution Architect – Associate level) will have a thorough understanding, familiarity and experience with Amazon Web Services. They will keep themselves up to date with the latest and greatest developments in the Public Cloud arena, and should have a thorough and deep understanding of key differentiators between Amazon Web Services and competing offerings from Azure, GCP etc.  Experience in the establishment of an automated DevOps release management pipeline which delivers tooling for next generation application development efforts (the Dev) and on-going production operations (the Ops).  A thorough and in-depth understanding of Container based architectures  Experience architecting infrastructure solutions (preferably on Amazon Web Services) using both Linux/Unix and Windows with specific recommendations on server, load balancing, HA/DR, & storage architectures  Experience with deploying cloud based solutions and workload migration strategy using tools  3+ years architecting, implementing and supporting Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services infrastructure and topologies  Experience with Enterprise application and database architecture  Understanding of Agile, SCRUM and Continuous Delivery  Demonstrated skills in communication (oral, written, presentation), analysis, problem solving and short term and long term planning  Experienced, persuasive and effective presenter, both written and verbal  Demonstrated skills in leadership, communication, coaching, analysis, problem solving and short term and long term planning  Knowledge of standard selling disciplines, specifically Solution Selling and RFP management  Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills, ability to handle diverse situations, multiple initiatives and rapidly changing priorities  Willingness to work outside of office base and most of all…  An appreciation of the consulting lifestyle and ability to travel (both locally and abroad) is a pre-requisite to fit to our short-term and long-term project assignment. 
Preferred Qualifications
 AWS Solution Architect – Professional certification  Working knowledge of software development practices and technologies highly desired  Degree in computer-science, engineering or equivalent  A robust understanding of ERP technical architectures – SAP, Oracle etc.  We’ll love you if you have multi-cloud (AWS, Azure or GCP or both) knowledge, and experience. 
 Next Steps 

So what are you waiting for? Join the winning team now.

 Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

jobDescription:
About Accenture
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
Accenture is an Irish-domiciled multinational professional services company that provides services in:
 Technology
 Strategy & Consulting
 Interactive
 Operations
As a Fortune Global 500 company, it has been incorporated in Dublin, Ireland since September 1, 2009. In 2019, the company reported revenues of $43.2 billion, with more than 492,000 employees serving clients in more than 200 cities in 120 countries.
Accenture Technology combines business and industry insights with innovative technology services to transform your business. Join one of the world’s largest independent providers of technology services to grow your expertise and help clients worldwide to innovate at scale and transform their businesses. Help change how the world works and lives through technology innovation.
Key responsibilities include:
Have deep understanding of the competitive landscape and unparalleled knowledge of Accenture offerings to create win/win solutions for our clients and Accenture.
Support Client facing activities related to sales and solution development at the C-suite and Director Levels on the Microsoft Platform
Communicates and translates complex technical requirements into competitive Client proposal offering an Accenture solution that addresses business needs
End-to-end responsibility of the end-to-end solution which may include ERP Platforms, Applications and IaaS (Azure, M365, D365)
Leverage experience and best practices, along with insights of competitors capability and behaviors; to support the Sales strategy
Work with teams to share the latest trends released in the market
Critical sales enablement role that interprets and translates client requirements into a technology solution
Collaboratively work across ecosystems (sales, delivery, and partners)
Lead a team of experts across the IT value stack
Participate in contract negotiations
Minimum of 10 years of experience in a Technology Environment with a strong focus on Infrastructure, Systems Integration and/or Application Outsourcing Services
Minimum of 7 years’ work experience in complex delivery management and/or leading solutions for any of the primary Cloud Hosting Providers (AWS, Azure, Google)
Minimum 4 years in pre-sales roles
Experienced in solution planning and deal shaping across the entire IT stack including business, Apps, Data, Infrastructure and Process mgmt.
Has good business acumen and able to work closely with different teams in client engagements to ensure superior quality and content of RFP responses.
Demonstrated experience and expertise in cloud architecture best practices
Good written and communication skills
All of our consulting professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen, technical and professional skills development. You’ll also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.
Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.
Looking forward to hear from you soon! Have a great day ahead.

Binance is the global blockchain company behind the world’s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.

Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world?

Binance is looking for an experienced and strategic HR Business Partner to support our business units across APAC. These would include both local and remote teams across several different functions including, but not limited to; Cloud. Payments, Risk etc.

Responsibilities
Responsible for aligning HR objectives with respective business units to deliver value added service.Provide strategic advice on the different functions of HR and ensure that all policies implemented are aligned with business objectives. Be the main point of contact for any employees queries and support resolving of complex issues. Work closely with management and employees to improve working relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention. Provide guidance and input on department structure, workforce planning and succession planning for a rapidly growing team. Ensure employee communication is handled timely and effectively. Perform other duties as required.
Requirements
2-3 years of relevant experience in multiple HR disciplines, including performance management, building a high performance culture, employee relations, employee engagement, and diversity.Strong professionalism and exceptional stakeholder management skills to partner with members of leadership and senior team members. Strong and logical communication ability and a strategic, problem solving mindset.Ability to work in a fast moving environment of a rapidly growing company.
Working at Binance
 Do something meaningful; Be a part of the future of finance technology and the no.1 company in the industry Fast moving, challenging and unique business problems International work environment and flat organisation Great career development opportunities in a growing company Possibility for relocation and international transfers mid-career Competitive salary Flexible working hours, Casual work attire

jobTitle: Financial Services Advisory, Head of Cloud & Data Centre-of-Excellence
jobDescription:
Job description:

 Job Description The KPMG financial services advisory team assists banks and capital market sectors in managing their day-to-day business challenges and developments. We support our financial services clients on multiple diverse consulting projects that include: 

  Business growth (e.g. market entry, customer insights, merger and acquisitions support)  Operational process improvements  Organisation-wide functional (re)design  Change management and project management  Digital and technology enablement  Programme management support Data driven transformation   As KPMG embarks on a rapid growth strategy to become the preferred data driven strategy execution firm in South East Asia, we established the propositions in data driven transformation, and cloud & data center-of-excellence for all the different line of businesses to serve our clients. The ideal candidate should have experience in digital and data driven transformation while working for cloud providers, consulting firm or financial services organisations. 

 This role involves: 

  Champion Cloud Technology & Data Centre-of-Excellence vision, strategy, and capabilities across data driven transformation proposition  Build new market entry strategies and drive transformative changes in our clients  Engage with C-Level executives across a diverse geo and to influence strategic solution development and deployment that unifies cloud into unique and differentiated offerings to support global revenue growth and adoption/utilization targets  Lead and deliver complex client engagements that analyze technology environment, enterprise specifics and requirements for large-scale businesses  Support the safe delivery of large transformation projects for KPMG by designing the safe and engineered delivery of change  Articulate the value-add and business impact of technology solutions to clients of different levels, across technical, functional and security aspects  Responsible for sales and conversion of large transformation projects from end to end bid management to enterprise solution design and delivery  Act as the SME within KPMG to design complex transformation change across the clients’ operating model, and champion for data drive transformation propositions and frameworks   ⠀ The ideal candidate should possess: 

  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information System, IT or equivalent  Minimum 15 years of working experience in IT system implementation with proven experience on delivering transformation projects such as system modernization, process re-design, operational efficiency, branch transformation  Demonstrated experience in leading the strategy, plan and design of IT roadmap and solutions to support business and operations across the organization  Demonstrated ability in providing technical leadership partnering with internal teams as well as key external business partners  Excellent working experience with cloud technology and providers such as MS Azure, GCP, Ali Cloud, Tencent Cloud, etc.  Professional certifications in AWS, MS Azure, Government Commercial Cloud (GCC) or Government Private Cloud (GPC) will be an added advantage  Proficiency in Python, Java, SQL, AI related frameworks (NLTK, Spacy, Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow)  Experience in large data warehouses, Big Data technologies, infrastructure components, ETL/ ELT and reporting/analytic tools  Experience in designing solutions utilizing one or more emerging technologies (e.g., cloud, AI and machine learning) to deliver business value which are secure, scalable, reliable and effective for adoption  Strong client and stakeholder management abilities coupled with excellent communication, written, analytical, organisational and problem-solving skills

At Dell Technologies, we create the extraordinary. Our Outside Sales Product Specialists are the experts who sell innovation to the world. Responsible for a set of products and services, they get to know their portfolio inside and out. Our Outside Sales teams rely on them for technical advice during the sales process. They directly advise customers on everything from product features and configurations, through to pricing and availability.

Join us as a Data Center Sales Specialist on our Outside Sales team in Singapore to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

What You’ll Achieve

The Data Center Sales, Technical BDM (Global Alliances, Singapore) role will be responsible for managing the largest and most strategic Global Alliance Partners. The role will manage a portfolio within the Singapore Market – interaction will be long term strategic, involve both technical and senior leadership relationship management.

He/she will be able to successfully connect technology solutions to address both partner and customer priorities to achieve business outcomes, whilst delivering superior experience and achieving sales goals. The Technical BDM leads a team across both virtually and cross functionally, effective communication and collaboration is key.

Technology focus will be on Compute / Networking / HCI / related Services & Consulting with a focus on workloads and outcome-based selling. Generally assigned to several Global Alliance Partners key success criteria include strong technical & consultative skills, and expertise both influencing and selling through and with partners.

You will:
Successfully manage the complexities of partner sales ecosystem. Propose and develop key customer product solutions Generate new business opportunities while maintaining relationship with existing business Communicate regularly with customers to deepen relationship and trust with Dell Proactively customize solutions based on customer needs and pain points Liaise closely with other internal sales functions to create overall strategy for named Global Alliance Partners 

Take the first step towards your dream career

Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements
8-10 years of Outside Sales experience from high tech industryKnowledge of Dell products/solutions or similar experienceExperience working with Global Alliance Partners / Partner Sales / Channel Sales is a must Cross-functional experience: comfortable working with other sales and marketing functionsFlexible, agile, and able to adapt to rapidly changing environment

Key Attributes:
Global Alliance Partners / Partner Sales / Channel Sales Professional Technology Sales Professional Collaborative & Team Oriented Leadership Consultative Sales / Technical Sales Driven & Motivated 

Here’s our story; now tell us yours

Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

jobTitle: Lead Software Engineer (AEM), IT – Digital Franchise Platform
jobDescription:
Job Purpose

You are responsible for designing and developing comprehensive solutions on Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) platform, that meet business requirements. You will need to partner with key roles (e.g. project managers, business analysts, vendors etc.) to craft solutions that are aligned to architecture standards and principles, leverage common solutions and services and meet timeline and financial targets. 

The Job

 Strong experience in designing and developing content fragments, experience fragments, custom components, and page templates using the Adobe AEM platform to attain desirable business outcomes. jobTitle: Cloud Security (Financial Services), Manager, Technology Consulting
jobDescription:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

Cyber threats, social media, massive data storage, privacy requirements and continuity of the business as usual require heavy information security measures. As an information security consultant, you will lead the implementation of security solutions for our clients and support the clients in their desire to protect the business.

The Opportunity

This is a role where no two days are the same – so you’ll find yourself taking on plenty of new responsibilities as you go. You’ll work alongside clients and colleagues, balancing your time between developing security strategies, advising stakeholders, providing workshops and supporting business development. If you’re flexible and ready to adapt to a constantly changing environment, there’s no better place to develop your skills. Since you’ll be working directly with clients, some travel will be required

Your Key Responsibilities

As a Cloud Security Senior Consultant, you will be part of the team to assess, design, build, implement and manage security solutions for our clients and support the clients in their desire to protect the business. You will belong to an international connected team of specialists helping our clients with their most complex information security needs and contributing toward their business resilience

Skills And Attributes For Success
6 years of strong experience in design and architecture of cloud security with at least one of the following cloud environments: Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services (AWS)Understand an organization’s security policies and standards for use in cloud environmentsInterpret security and technical requirements into business requirements and communicate security risks to relevant stakeholders ranging from business leaders to engineersCollaborate with application developers and database administrators to deliver creative solutions to difficult technology challenges and business requirementsPlan and design security architectures for cloud cloud/hybrid systemsAbility to automate security controls, data, and processes to provide improved metrics and operational supportEmploy cloud-based APIs when suitable to write network/system level tools for safeguarding cloud environments 

To Qualify for the role, you must have
A recognized university degree in Computer Science, Computer/Electrical Engineering, Information Technology or equivalentAt least 6 years of relevant experience. Preferably with 2 years experience in business consulting role in a leading consultancy firmPossess a CISSP certificationStrong interest in the field of information securityCreative, independent with good problem-solving skillsExcellent communicator with strong analytical, interpersonal and writing skills 

Ideally, you’ll also have
Industry related certification preferred (e.g. CISSP, CISA, CISM, SABSA, PRINCE2, TOGAF, ITIL).Cloud certification with leading public cloud vendors like Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services (AWS).Solution Level Certifications, OSCP, CREST, GIAC would be advantageous, as well as penetration testing experience 

What We Look For

Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.

What Working At EY Offers

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. We also offer you:
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.

Apply now.

EY | Building a better working world 

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

We are seeking talented Senior Cloud Software Engineer to join us in building the next generation Mapping Software to create large, accurate, and safe HD Maps, fast. We are building a mapping system that supports mapping at a scale of billions of data points from different sensors and data sources used by hundreds of users and operators spread out across different cities and time zones in Asia and the United States of America. HD Maps enable our autonomous cars to navigate from point A to point B. It is a critical set of information to make the smartest safe decisions on the road. With an ever expanding footprint of mapped areas, we enable teams of researchers, engineers, testers, and operators across the entire company to explore uncharted territory by enabling our self-driving cars to learn from new environments and go where no other self-driving car has gone before.
We are seeking talented Software Engineers to help develop and roll out the next generation of our advanced tools to support autonomous driving.
Things you'll get to work on:Design, plan, and implement future improvements of the mapping backend system for scalability and performanceWork with large-scale point cloud, image, and other sensor data to build maps for our growing fleet of self-driving carsSupport full software development life cycleProvide guidance and mentorship to team to build cloud competenciesWrite high quality, idiomatic, and maintainable code
Education and Experience we hope you'll come with:BS or MS in Computer Science or related field3+ years of experience in architecting, designing, and implementing cloud solutions on AWSFamiliarity with Docker, containerization technology, and KubernetesFamiliarity with Serverless ArchitecturesExperience in Test Driven Development and writing testable codeExperience in troubleshooting and tuning systemsGood knowledge of Python or C++ and OOP principlesGood knowledge of a particular development ecosystem, such as developing modules, publishing packages and using various dev tools (linting, code analysis)Ability to articulate ideas to non-technical audience
Bonus points for:Knowledge of geospatial data, libraries, and toolsPrior experience with HD Maps and/or mapping for self-driving cars

jobTitle: Global Product Planning/Launch Manager: Monitor Stands (Open)
jobDescription:
Product Management Senior Advisor

Showcasing excellence and innovation at every stage, Product Management is responsible for the cross-functional management of products or solutions through their entire lifecycle. Using a wealth of technical and industry experience, we work across functional areas to implement our products or solutions. We undertake thorough analysis of the markets to ensure we maximize profitability and adjust our product strategies to respond to competition. Our role also involves acting as subject matter experts for internal and external product events or partner meetings.

Join us as a Product Management, Senior Advisor on our Product Management team to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

What You’ll Achieve

As a Product Management Senior Advisor, you will identify new growth areas, technologies and emerging product/service opportunities. You will conduct in-depth market analysis to optimize existing products/solutions and build next generation products, partnering closely with the Engineering and Product Management teams to build a product road map and align product strategies for the business.

You will:
You will create and own Dell Monitor Arms/Stands product roadmaps; to define and conceptualize next gen experiences for our customers across the globe.Require a deep pulse on what matters for Monitor Arms/Stands, and how to relate and stay relevant in a rapidly evolving industry.Need to effectively translate the nuanced voice and needs of our customers into experiences that underpin our clear product value propositionBe the product evangelist; product subject matter expert in the room for all our stakeholders (e.g. support functions, regional sales and go to market teams)Work closely alongside Client system teams to deliver a unique ecosystem experience for our customersEngagement across segments/geographies to effectively develop product positioning, strategy, taking into close account regional and market requirements.Develop & present issues/updates & proposals to executive managementManage products throughout their entire lifecycle

Take the first step towards your dream career

Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements
Excellent technology/engineering skills relating to design, test and qualitySolid grasp of business goals and objectives as they relate to customer use cases and solutionsExcellence in understanding competitors and their products as well as potential partner relationships for the product

Desirable Requirements
Proven experience working on a world-class product8 to 12 years of relevant experience

Here’s our story; now tell us yours

Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Application closing date: 16th March

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.

jobDescription:
Assurity Trusted Solutions (ATS) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Government Technology Agency (GovTech), incorporated to operate the National Authentication Framework (NAF) and National Certification Authority (NCA). We aim to be the Source of Trust in the use of digital services, and committed to enhance Trust and High Assurance of digital services by providing secure and convenient identity management solutions.
Are you ready to be part of the only National Certification Authority (NCA) in Singapore which provides high assurance solutions that enable consumers and businesses to enjoy more seamless and safe digital transactions in their everyday lives?
We are looking for a Cloud Security Specialist to join us in our mission to enhance Singapore’s competitiveness as a trusted ICT hub for citizens and businesses, and to expand our product offerings into new regional markets.
A brief summary of your job responsibility:Formulate and enforce IT security framework and management processes which includes security policies, procedures, standards and guidelines.Provide consultation support on Privileged Management, End-pint protection technologies, vulnerability scanning solutions, Commercial Cloud-native security tools and Zero-Trust network toolsCreate and maintain up to date incident response playbooks. Perform incident response actions in response to security incidents.Perform IT security assessments (such as security risk assessment, system technical controls review etc).Assess and review existing processes/baselines and security measures to ensure they are working effectively.Review and enhance controls against possible lessons from external incidents and emerging cyber risks. To succeed in this role, you will ideally have:Bachelor Degree / Diploma holder in IT / information security or equivalent.5 or more years of experience in IT, of which 3 years in information security.Candidate with a strong application, infrastructure, commercial cloud or zero-trust network experience are welcome to apply.Knowledge and understanding of public key infrastructure, cloud technologies, cybersecurity, risk management, security framework and methodologies for controls, compliance and auditing such as NIST, ISO 27001, Center for Internet Security (CIS) Benchmark.Independent and able to perform tasks with minimum supervision.Highly analytical, process-oriented, collaborative and creative individual.Candidate with professional certifications such as CEH, CISSP, CISA or CCSP will be an advantage.

The Regional Cloud Sales Executive is a senior level management position that leverages public and private Cloud technical knowledge to promote sales of Teradata analytical solutions, as well as defining messaging and marketing positioning for these offerings within the Region . This role requires management and working with focused, and cloud-proven team to be cloud blackbelt sellers with in each region and a focus on increasing Teradata’s cloud sales funnel. It also requires broad knowledge of deployments around public Cloud providers (preferably Amazon Web Services and Azure), as well as the Big Data, data warehouse and analytic space, and experience with Teradata products and technologies. This role must articulate Cloud analytical ecosystem architectures and trends while providing technical consulting as a trusted advisor to support sales activities.
Collaborate very tightly with regional, geography/industry leadership to identify and build cloud migration plans for customer interest generation, business case build out, POC, and commercial deal closing.Drive cloud migration plans at scale through all account plans and act as a coach and facilitator on elements within their sphere of influence.Work in tight collaboration with the WW Cloud Blackbelt Architect team to progress and close key cloud deals, and ensure that the cloud playbook is utilized at scale across each regionWork closely with the WW Alliances and Partners team to leverage partner relationships across CSP’s, SI’s, ISV’s, and resellers to progress cloud deals
In this role you will be responsible to collaborate with industry leadership to help build out and drive cloud migration plans and drive cloud migration plans at scale across all account plans for with a focus on developing, coaching and facilitation on elements within your sphere of influence. The main focus is improving field confidence selling Teradata’s cloud solutions. Program initiatives range from field skills development to targeted sales initiatives in Alliances & Partners to new product launches, spanning the entire Go-To-Market organization.

You must be a motivated self-starter and excellent communicator, excited to work with cross-functional team members and sales account teams to collaborate and execute against a program scope.

Key Responsibilities
Spends time in front of customer executives as a key advisor, articulating high level value propositions around Teradata’s cloud solutionsDevelops architectures and best practices for deployment of Teradata analytical ecosystems on public Cloud providers such as AWS and AzureEducates sales teams on the latest developments around Teradata Cloud solution offeringsUnderstands and communicate customer-specific value of Teradata solutions customer interest generation, business case build out, POC, and commercial deal closingWork in tight collaboration with the WW Cloud Blackbelt Architect team to progress and close key cloud deals, and ensure that the cloud playbook is utilized at scale across the regionWork closely with the WW Alliances and Partners team to leverage partner relationships across CSP’s, SI’s, ISV’s, and resellers to progress cloud dealsCreates client interest in Teradata Cloud solutions, advancing the sales process close key cloud deals, and ensure that the cloud playbook is utilized at scale across each regionSync regularly with account team leads, executive account directors, and area Vice Presidents to discuss account strategy and future sales opportunitiesSupport cross-functional global cloud program development efforts in support of company strategic & operational planning goalsDrive the development and rollout program materials & documentation, including high-fidelity presentations, recordings, and customer-facing materialsIdentify the order of importance and urgency among individual projects, portfolios and operational tasks to plan milestones, schedules and resourcesDrive major decisions, identify and eliminate risks and blockers, communicate program status to stakeholders and leadershipBuild and maintain effective relationships with resources, partners, colleagues and leaders with accountability for delivering on commitments and partner needs
Key Attributes of Success
Ability to clearly communicate complex ideasDeep technical understanding of deploying analytic systems in the Cloud (preferably AWS and Azure)Ability to develop customer relationshipsKnowledge of the larger competitive landscapeOperational rigorous with attention to detail to turn strategy into plans and plans into execution.
Basic Qualifications
7 years or more of sales experience in the spaceClient interface and consulting skills required, with special focus on clear communicationsExperience in Executive communication sessionsExperience with “on-premise to cloud” migrations Experience operating solutions built on AWS and/or Azure Significant experience working with advanced analytics professionalsBS in Computer Science, or comparable experience
Teradata is an equal opportunity employer in all aspects of our business. We are excited by the unique qualities, abilities, and perspectives each person brings, and candidates are considered on all the fundamentals they may bring to the role and the team.

Our Company

Teradata (NYSE TDC) is the leading multi-cloud data platform company for enterprise analytics, transforming how businesses work and people live through the power of data.

At Teradata, we are leading the data era. As enterprises address today’s digital economy, they are faced with new competition and consumer expectations and are turning to data to power their future. Teradata has worked with the largest companies in the world for 40+ years, bringing our experience and expertise to support global enterprises with their most demanding, mission-critical, complex, and large-scale data needs. Teradata is recognized as a leader in the cloud, data, and analytics spaces by top analyst firms, Gartner and Forrester, and Fortune Magazine as well.

Our connected multi-cloud data platform for enterprise analytics, Teradata Vantage™, is an extremely scalable, secure, and resilient offering that simplifies ecosystems by connecting data and making it easier to uncover insights from across the organization…regardless of where that data resides. With Vantage, we enable companies to modernize their data management, from start to scale. Every day, millions of users benefit from our open data platform. Empowering customers and partners to develop and build how they like, we enable hundreds of business outcomes and solutions, including improving customer experience and profitability, driving operational efficiency, realizing financial transformation, or achieving operational efficiency.

As the world of data grows, we are the leader in enabling the future of connected businesses, powered by data intelligence. We are committed to delivering on this vision by following sustainable business practices and with a strong focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion. We believe that only by embracing diversity of identity, thought, background, expression, and perspective can we solve today’s challenges and reimagine tomorrow’s world.

What We Offer

Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!

Security DevOps Engineer for Multi Cloud

We are Multicloud SecDevOps, the Security Operations team helping to protect workloads running in SAP’s constantly growing public cloud landscape across AWS, Azure, GCP and Alibaba Cloud. Working closely with our peer teams in Multicloud Operations and colleagues in SAP Global Security, we deliver security tooling and services, scan the large global landscape for security compliance and make the results available across the organization through security analytics, and support SAP’s security incident response processes in public cloud.

We are transforming the way SAP does security, using the latest cloud-native and cloud security best practices and developing our own, to day-by-day provide a safer environment for our lines of business to operate in, using a DevSecOps approach to Security Operations. We are expanding the scope of central security and compliance services across the global landscape, innovating our way through the challenges involved in securing a multi cloud environment of significant scale and growth rate, across a large complex and varied organization.

A successful candidate shall have a clear passion for security, in particular cloud security, and want to be part of this security transformation – we’re on a mission and looking for Security DevOps engineers who want to make a real material difference in making our cloud security top class through continuous improvement. Maybe you’re used to developing your own tools and been waiting for an opportunity in cloud security but not had the opportunity yet in your current role. Maybe you’re doing cloud-native DevOps, but your real interest is in the security aspect only and want to develop and operate effective central security services at large scale. If so, we’d like to hear from you.

How You Might Contribute

SAP MultiCloud is seeking a Security Operations Engineer for the SecDevOps team to help continuously improve SAPs public cloud security posture on AWS, Azure, GCP and AliBaba Cloud. Be part of a security-controls-as-code team to strengthen the security of our cloud landscapes and visibility in its compliance posture.

We’ve made significant improvements in recent years but have a lot more on the roadmap! Have a look at our Multi Cloud Security Jam to see the things we’re doing and get involved with using the link below, including the Hyperscale Security Blogs.

https://jam4.sapjam.com/groups/rfjLPU42pSuICiflCl7pMp/overview_page/S4HS1GsL3GMtO4uEPvVjn7

Successful Candidate Expectations

Skills

It would be very useful to additionally have any of the following skills and experience

A clear passion for security in public cloud is a prerequisite for the role. We are a diverse, globally dispersed team that has stressed hiring for talent, self-motivation and ability to learn, vs. a focus on certifications.
2+ years of increasingly progressive experience in a DevOps role, including git, YAML, monitoring and continuous delivery1+ years of experience in an operations role (security operations, support, etc.) and use of ticketing systems such as ServiceNow or JIRAPrior Experience in security compliance, security monitoring, security incident response, and/or security analytics preferred, preferably in public cloud environmentsUnderstanding of DevOps, ideally DevSecOps, principles and cloud-native CI/CD processesExperience with Linux administration, shell scripting, and (cloud-native) open-source security toolsKubernetes and container-based workloadsSolid understanding of public cloud providers and hands-on experience on one or more of AWS, Azure, GCP or AliBaba Cloud
As the team operates globally and largely virtually, we gladly consider virtual candidates already located in Singapore.

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. Position Overview

The team is focused on building the next gen platform for the Customer Identity and Access Management Solutions.

Responsibilities

As a Developer Relations Engineer (DevRel Intern), you will write code that other developers use as a reference. You will create and deliver content to help them learn and use Autodesk's Identity service APIs. Also, you will answer the developer queries on various forums. On this highly cross-functional team, you will work with partners in Engineering, Product management, and other customer-facing teams. While much of the team output is content and responding to developer queries, engineering is at the heart of everything we do. To teach developers how to use these technologies, we first must understand them deeply ourselves. You may be the first developer to build something with a new API. Additionally, you will help to develop/maintain tools that are frequently used by DevRel team.

Minimum Qualifications

Undergraduate in Computer Engineering

Preferred Qualifications
 Excellent communication and problem-solving skills  Experience with cloud services such as AWS, Google Cloud, Azure etc would be given preference  Passion for helping developers  Comfortable working with a broad range of tools 
Learning Benefits

The intern will learn the practices employed by a Developer Relations Engineer or a Developer Advocates. You will be responsible for promoting the adoption of Autodesk' Identity API services, as well as help other developers to have a delightful onboarding experience.

With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, construction, manufacturing, and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity.

jobTitle: Data Analyst, Data Management, Governance & Data Analytics
jobDescription:
About SATS – Feed And Connect Communities

SATS is Asia's leading provider of food solutions and gateway services. Using innovative food technologies and resilient supply chains, we create tasty, quality food in sustainable ways for airlines, foodservice chains, retailers and institutions. With heartfelt service and advanced technology, we connect people, businesses and communities seamlessly through our comprehensive gateway services for customers such as airlines, cruise lines, freight forwarders, postal services and eCommerce companies.

Fulfilling our purpose to feed and connect communities, SATS delights customers in over 55 locations and 14 countries across the Asia Pacific, UK, and the Middle East. SATS has been listed on the Singapore Exchange since May 2000. For more information, please visit www.sats.com.sg.

Key Responsibilities

Data Management and Governance

Design, develop and implement datasets, models, as well as support to interpret and present statistical outcomes to support the organisation’s operations and execution of key business strategiesDesign and conceptualize solutions that address the organisation’s challenges through use of data management and governance of large amount of dataCollaborate with stakeholders to build data management and governance capabilities, conduct feasibility studiesKnowledge of ETL and OLAP to support and contribute to database implementation and systems, devising strategies to promote continuous improvementDevise methods and strategies to obtain and extract data to derive business insights.

Data Analytics

Build data pipelines and functions for visualisation and business analytics supporting the business and respective product ownersDeliver accurate regular and ad-hoc performance tracking and analysis to drive traffic, transactions and processesAd-hoc analysis based on strategic direction of the business and deep dive into specific area / trendMake data management recommendations based on data and industrial practices Assist in business case and pricing initiatives as required

Key Requirements

Degree holder in Information Systems, Business / Data Analytics, Information Technology or Computer Science with at least 3-5 years of data engineering and/or business analyticsUnderstanding of and experience using data governance concepts, techniques and toolsWorking knowledge of data mining principles: mapping, collecting data from multiple data systems on premises and cloud-based data sourcesIn-depth understanding of and experience in designing structured and unstructured, SQL and NoSQL data repositoriesExperience working with, creating and maintaining databases and repositories using state-of-the-art data backup, rollback and version control solutions.Proficient with data engineering methods and technologies / tools such as ETL, R and/or Python. Azure Cloud proficiency will be an advantageHighly motivated, structured and methodical with high degree of initiativeStrong problem solving, quantitative and analytical abilitiesExcellent written and oral communication skillsAble to work independently or cross functionally

jobTitle: Partner Specialist (B2B Cloud Tech - North Asia/SEA/ANZ - Expansion Market)
jobDescription:
At ServiceSource, we strive to find and grow exceptional people like you.
Working at ServiceSource, you will be a part of an engaging, energetic, and entrepreneurial work environment while having the stability and influence of a nearly 20-year industry leader behind you. ServiceSource is a place where you can GROW, both personally and professionally, while expanding your skills in sales, customer success and people management.
Partner SpecialistExplore career opportunities with us if you are passionate about sharing the value and benefits of our client's products through meaningful engagement with a focus on managing channel partners.
The Partner Specialist is responsible for effectively enabling the account management and sales process for a client’s products and services for an assigned territory/client, with moderate variables in geography and/or customer complexity. Armed with technical understanding, you will understand and capture the voice of the customer for assigned client.
As part of our expansion growth, we are looking for an individual who has prior sales management experience in fast moving consumer / electronics engineering or technology industry with a relationship building mindset with the capacity for quick thinking. This is a permanent and full time position.
Duties And ResponsibilitiesDrive customer retention and revenue growth for an established customer base.Achieve defined metrics by enabling the sale of products/services to a portfolio of strategic channel engagement partners.Provide accurate weekly/monthly/quarterly sales forecasts.Conduct monthly/quarterly consultative reviews and health checks analyzing business needs.Create talk tracks specifically related to customer health and use predictive data to identify ‘at-risk’ customers.Maintain overall health of channel, ensuring high satisfaction levels, with constant evaluation of channel experience and leverage feedback to drive change.Manage all channel escalations and coordinate delivery of prompt and successful resolution, while maintaining communication to client and internal teams.Facilitate and drive calls with channel partner to share best practices, communicate and drive channel programs and strategic growth opportunities to expand business.Ensure value visible to client by sharing insights with proactive engagement on key initiatives.Create, develop and deliver training to the sales team, sharing key learning and reinforcing the unique value and benefits of products.Ensure high level of professionalism during all interactions with customers and prospects.Effectively partner and build strong business relationships with both internal and external stakeholders and global peers to ensure customer expectations are met.Collaborate with cross-functional teams and management to optimize sales processes, systems and achieve a superior customer experience.Maintain a high level of CRM hygiene to ensure all relevant data is captured in a timely and consistent manner.
CompetenciesThis role will require you to provide channel solutions to our expanding market in North Asia (NA), South East Asia (SEA) and Australia New Zealand (ANZ) region.Prior success in achievement in individual and/or team sales quota/goals.Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with customers in a fast-paced environment while developing positive customer/partner relationships.Prior experience in high volume calling required.Demonstrated aptitude to learn and optimize new technology and data.
Other Information5 days work week (Mon - Fri / regular working hours).Singapore office is at walking distance from nearest MRT (Labrador Park).Permanent position, work from home required.
Uninterrupted home-based internet is required for this role. Applicants should have sufficient internet access in their homes to attend and host video calls, as well as perform essential functions of the role which include downloading and uploading of large files to shared network drives.
If this sounds like an interesting opportunity, hit (easy) apply!All shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Security Operations Center (SOC) is expanding physical and security services operations to support the growth of our data centers and related security functions. The AWS SOC Security Services Team is seeking a self-motivated SOC Security Analyst with security technology experience, problem-solving abilities, analysis skills, and strong customer obsession.

Come join the team tasked with raising the level of security on a global scale, across new and existing AWS infrastructure. The AWS SOC Security Analyst will work with security leaders and partners, providing timely and accurate support within the physical security realm of the data center environment. This person will manage communications, facilitate operational needs, generate and/or manage trouble tickets, and provide additional services as required.

The AWS SOC is a 24/7/365 operation, you can expect operational hours weekday work and rotational on-call support over weekends. Here in AWS, we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Key job responsibilities
 Investigate security findings, researches mitigation's, and analyzes potential security vulnerability related information from a variety of sources to remediate root cause Configure physical security devices including cameras, readers. Manage high security events, communicate risks to AWS stakeholders, and escalate to drive mitigation Utilize security mindset and judgement to assess security risks across the organization and escalate accordingly Works as an enabler to bring stakeholders together to address findings and risks until a formalized business owner is identified to take lead. Produce progress reports, briefs, and white papers regarding vulnerabilities, security concerns, and operations gaps that affect AWS data center operations and/or AWS reputation. Consults closely with the other Amazon security and service teams on issues related to AWS security posture. Interface with technical teams, stakeholders and leadership teams to translate security risk mitigation plans into actionable items to mitigate risk.

Basic Qualifications
 Bachelor’s degree in a security discipline, Computer Science, MIS, Engineering, (or) 3+ years’ equivalent security technology, data center operations, and or physical/technical security experience 1 year of experience working in an operations center or equivalent environment 2 years previous experience using MS Office Suite and other Microsoft products to include Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, SharePoint, etc. 2 years of experience demonstrating multitasking skills including the ability to communicate quickly and effectively, both written and verbally, while executing technical tasks or functions
Preferred Qualifications
 Knowledge of security technology, risk assessment methodologies, policies, and processes. Familiarity with cloud architecture/infrastructure and general networking principles Experience in systems and/or network administration Experience with cloud security operations in AWS Experience demonstrating the ability to produce reports for senior managers, internal departments, and external stakeholders regarding physical security events, cyber threats, cloud security, and physical security infrastructure as they affect operations and customers globally Experience using automation to solve problems and reduce repetitive tasks Understanding of scripting languages, such as JS, Ruby, and HTML Experience engaging in project management, tracking timelines, and participating in planning and executing tasks within project milestones
