jobDescription:
About Accenture

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

At the heart of every great change is a great human.

Come work at the heart of change.

Take the first step to a fulfilling tech career at Accenture. You will be exposed to the exciting work within the Public Sector, helping Singapore achieve its Smart Nation vision as you develop your career. Enhance your skills through continuous learning and development opportunities to build and strengthen your expertise in the ever-growing technology space.

You can also expect to receive professional training, mentorship and career coaching to help empower, drive, and guide you in your career aspirations and decisions.

As a software engineering associate, you will:

Be involved in the development, coding, testing, deployment, and software maintenance of the applications and products. 

Team up with others, like yourself, to develop and deliver solutions with continuous innovation and bring new ideas to our clients, improving the way operations is run.

Operate IT production services according to management protocols and Service Level Agreements (SLAs).

Together with your team, support various phases of the Software Development Lifecycle, ensuring client satisfaction and delivery excellence.

Provide operational support, ensuring production systems and devices are online and available.

Opportunity to use some of the most advanced technology around such as cloud engineering and operations, automation, RPA and SRE, intelligent call centre technologies.

Your role assignment will be based on business needs and your personal strengths.

We would love to speak with you if you have:

A Diploma / Higher Nitec / Nitec in Information Technology

A willingness to learn and an interest in technology

Good communication and interpersonal skills

Flexibility and willingness to work on different projects, if required

It would be advantageous if you are versed in the following tech stacks:

Java / J2EE / .Net / Fullstack development

DevSecOps

Data engineering / R / Python

Low code development platforms 

Documents and Information Required

Resume (in PDF format)

Latest education transcript

Indicate your availability (start and end date) and expected graduation date in your resume

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

You will also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.

Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

The Java Platform Group is looking for an experienced, passionate, and highly motivated Test Engineer to join our world class development efforts. Our team is responsible for delivering and testing the Java Management Service (JMS) in the cloud that is used by millions of developers. We are looking for a seasoned engineer with a strong Java programming background, cloud service development and testing experience and a desire to make a positive change in our product.
Java Management Service (JMS), now generally available (GA), is a new Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) native service to help manage Java runtimes and applications on-premises or on any cloud. JMS offers a single pane of glass to manage Java deployments across the enterprise. It provides continuous insight based on telemetry data from the JVM to analyze security, performance, compliance, and efficiency metrics.
Our goal is to have engineers writing well designed, robust, reliable, repeatable, and maintainable tests that find issues early and provide adequate coverage for the component under testing. The primary focus for this position will be on Java Platform installation and management as a cloud service, cloud security and scalability testing and verification.
 ResponsibilitiesYou will be expected to work with a wide range of features and component teams in order to drive quality of Java Management ServiceCreate the next generation of testing tools, techniques, and infrastructure to increase the speed of release cyclesWork closely with engineering teams to understand new technologies, design and develop functional test suite to ensure the quality of the productHave a good understanding of developing tests in Java for functional, regression tests as well as concept of Canary testing and cloud deployment techniquesEnsuring timely software releases by improving efficiency, productivity, and consistency of testing
RequirementsBS in a technical discipline. MS desirable. At least 8 years’ experience in software development or testingStrong Java programming background; Java Certified Developer and/or Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Developer is highly desiredHands on experience with using Selenium framework or others, Ansible, Python or JavaScript is preferredExperience with cloud scalability testing techniques and tools and hands on experience with Dynamic and Static analysis tools such as Fortify, Spotbugs, Webscan will be a plusWorking experience on Linux/Unix/Windows/macOSExtensive test and troubleshooting experience especially in cloud infrastructureExcellent oral and written communication skillsMotivated and results oriented individualAbility to thrive and grow in a fast-paced team environmentAbility to conceive, plan, implement, and collaborate with distributed teams on process improvements and productivity enhancement tools is a plus, not required

jobTitle: Lead Software Engineer, IT – Digital Affinity (Customer)
jobDescription:
Job Purpose

You will be leading a team of developers in Digital Projects to deliver the approved solution designed. As a Lead Software Engineer, you will need to communicate with various stakeholders (External Partners, Business and IT), both locally and regionally, to assess, coordinate and execute technical requests/implementations to ensure timely project/enhancements delivery. 

The Job

 Responsible for end-to-end technical solutioning for the project(s) assigned. Lead a team of application developers to plan technical deliverables to meet project’s requirements within allocated budget and schedule. Participate in the coding together with the application development team. Plan & collaborate across different domain application teams to manage technical and security related dependencies of the solution. Plan, monitor and manage risks/issues related to technical application delivery and to provide L3 support as needed. Partner with Project Manager, Business Analyst, Infrastructure teams, vendors and other solution teams to deliver project deliverables, enhancements and manage software releases. Have a hands on approach to ensure that the application teams build the enhancements according to the solution plan. Partner with Test Manager/Testers to ensure completion of SIT, UAT, Non-Functional Testing and Application Security Testing with quality outcomes. Act as a subject matter expert in the web / mobile application space and constantly keep up with knowledge of new concepts, emerging technology, and architecture. Problem solver with ability to see things in multiple angles, and constantly push boundaries to improve status quo. You are expected to interact with specialist teams like security, compliance and facilitate workshops/meetings to resolve issues. Escalate issues that impacts project schedule on timely basis and propose workarounds/resolutions. Prepare and present implementation model or new technology implementation model to the Enterprise Architecture Review Board. 

 Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks. Maintains awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company. Highlights any potential concerns /risks and proactively shares best risk management practices.

jobTitle: Global Infrastructure - Lead Engineer Cloud Team
jobDescription:
Find what drives you on a team with a more than 70-year history of discovery, determination, and innovation. As a global leader in high-tech filtration, separation, and purification, Pall Corporation thrives on helping our customers protect people. Our products serve a wide range of markets, so if your interests lie along the spectrum of Life Sciences to Industrial, you’ll find a rewarding role here. For the exponentially curious, Pall is a place you can thrive and amplify your impact on the world.

Pall is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.

The Opportunity

We are seeking a Senior Engineer to focus on securing our hosting platforms. The ideal candidate has a proven track record building large, scalable infrastructure, is a creative thinker, problem solver, teacher, and learner. This position reports to the Global Infra Senior Director – Hosting.

Responsibilities:
Development of a cloud security platform covering strategy, procedures, and tooling relating to cloud security to provide support to the Life Sciences PlatformCloud Hosting (Amazon AWS)Enterprise Windows Management (Active Directory, Operating Systems)Identity Management (MIM)Single Sign On (ADFS)On-premises Virtualization (primarily Hyper-V)Own the build & deploy lifecycle; drastically reduce build, deploy & rollback times while simultaneously reducing risk and exposure.Help transform our legacy infrastructure to a modern scalable service-based system.
Requirements:
Proven track record of successfully delivering large-scale services on public clouds such as AWS, and in an enterprise Windows environment.Solid with Infrastructure as code tools and config management tools.Experienced building global solutions with remote teams and workersAn excellent communicator, with the ability to simplify key messages, present compelling stories and promote technical and personal credibility with internal and external stakeholders.Deeply familiar with understanding distributed system design, micro service architecture, containers, and dependency management. You will understand how teams need to work to manage this inherent complexity
English

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

If you’ve ever wondered what’s within you, there’s no better time to find out.

The JAPAC Cloud Engineering Center of Excellence (CE CoE) is a new regional organisation across Japan and Asia Pacific whose role is to accelerate consumption of Oracle Cloud Services by providing a world-class customer experience on the Oracle Cloud. Customers will have access to cutting edge and deep technical subject matter expertise and solutions. The CoE is organized by Technology Domains such as Infrastructure, Packaged Applications, Custom Applications, Data Management, Analytics and others, which will provide relevant subject matter expertise in engagements. The primary goal of these teams is to move customer workloads to production environments to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) for Strategic customer implementations and for the Pitch to Production (P2P) initiative.
We are looking for exceptional candidates for the Custom Applications Domain for the JAPAC CoE. Success is measured providing the field and customers with world class technical subject matter expertise and drive the following outcomes
Cloud consumption growthNew cloud customer acquisitionA high performance, innovative, agile and collaborative teamContinuous improvement of time to value

Skills and Profile
TechnicalCoreDeep architectural experience in designing solution and technical architectures that deliver expected business benefits and prove to be resilient in the face of changing business requirements.Experience architecting, building, and maintaining Cloud applications on cloud platforms e.g., Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google CloudClear success stories of being involved in engagements where monolithic applications were migrated to microservices or where a greenfield microservices development was involved.Understands how to containerize applications and manage the resulting infrastructure lifecyle and is experienced in the use of relevant technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes etc.Fluent in CI/CD tooling and automation capabilitiesExperience with Agile and SCRUM-based projects or working with rapid and iterative technical design/implementation projectsHands on expertise in some of the core Oracle Technology products is required e.g. WebLogic, Oracle Database etc.Exposure to Infrastructure Automation Tools – Terraform, Chef, Ansible, Saltstack, Puppet, etc (Infrastructure As Code) to automate environment deployment is a definite advantage.Experience in developing using REST-style web services / APIs is required.Understand software development at a fundamental level, use the best tools for the job, and always think about the future (at scale) when architecting solutionsExperience building modern streaming architectures leveraging technologies such as: Kafka, Docker, Elasticsearch etc is a definite advantage.Development expertise in one or more software languages, such as Java, Python, Go, JavaScript, C++ or similar.
DesirableExperience in using application integration technologies such as API gateways etc would be an advantage
FunctionalA minimum of 10-12 years experience in software development using a combination of Oracle products and open source tooling to deliver both on premise and cloud applicationsDiscuss key trends and insights and leverage them in driving executive decision-making discussion with customersA passionate self-starter in developing new architectures to solve enterprise challenges. Research, test, and document new technologiesAbility to translate customer requirements into a scope and implementation planUnderstanding of commercial business to effectively position Oracle solutions and why they offer superior TCO vs competitionExcellent communication and presentation skills and highly comfortable speaking across all levels of management and technical audiencesBuild strong relationships with HQ Engineering/Product Management teams to be a customer advocate with HQ Development on required enhancements or in support escalationsClearly able to understand and articulate the Oracle Go-To-Market strategy in JAPAC across the Oracle portfolio
Roles and Responsibilities
Deliver successful Customer Engagements leading to increased consumptiono Collaborate with the cloud architects in the field to define the scope and deliverables of the customer implementations and deliver them as part of a virtual teamo Support the cloud architect in describing the proposed workload migration to the customer thereby gaining their confidence.o Ensure the work delivered is of the highest quality and to the deadlines committed.o Leverage reference architectures and associated assets to automate as much of the migration as possible.o Actively participate in the team meetings undertaking the migration using an Agile methodologieso Transfer skills to customer, partner or other delivery organizations during the migration to ensure a seamless customer experience post the involvement of the CoE team
Thought Leadership and Evangelismo Continuously invest in deepening domain skills by taking relevant training courseso Work closely with HQ Development to gain early competence in new domain solutions.o Have a deep understanding of the competitors equivalent cloud offerings and OCI competitive differentiatorso Speak at industry events and seminars
Cross-collaboration and Stakeholder Engagemento Work closely and collaboratively as one team with other CoE Custom Applications team members, field cloud architects and other domains within the CoE.o Contribute to the relevant Communities of Practice (CoP) to foster better collaboration between CoE and the Fieldo Identify and develop team assets (white papers, blogs, slack support, reference architectures, and software migration components) to help other groups gain relevant experience in deploying their domain solutions on OCI.
Governance & Reportingo Complete all relevant certifications and other mandatory enablemento Fully understand and leverage the systems in place to support customer workload migrations and other strategic engagements.o Provide timely status updates and other reports as required.
This role is can be based in Singapore / ANZ / Hong Kong / India
Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.

Big Cloud are partnering with a globally-renowned logistics company who are looking to bring on a Cloud Architect/ Systems Engineering Leader into their IT Infrastructure team in Singapore.You will be leading, overseeing and building mission-critical infrastructure used to run production applications in the region. 
You will be part of a talented team of engineers that demonstrate technical competency, delivering mission-critical infrastructure and ensuring the highest levels of availability, performance and security. jobDescription:
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content. 
Responsibilities- Support the Sales Teams to Qualify leads, Identify Customers' Pain Points and Translate Technologies into Solutions that meet Customers' Business Goals. - Call upon Technical Expertise and Sales Acumen to lead the Qualification process through Demos, Presentations, Architecture Design Sessions & Technical Workshops.- Lead RFPs/RFIs/Hands-on POCs by owning the overall process, and ensuring an optimum collaboration across all stakeholders. Convert POCs into Contracts. - Become a Trusted Advisor Internally and Externally by providing Thought Leadership, Industry Knowledge, and deep understanding across all Technologies that Bytedance B2B is providing.- Collaborate with all stakeholders including Solution Team, Product Team, Strategy, and R&D, to help influence product roadmap based on Market Feedback in your region.- Build or improve Tools and Processes to help scale highly customized Technical POCs.- Present to C-Suite, Business and Technical stakeholders to help raise brand awareness of Bytedance B2B across APAC. Articulate Business and Technical value. - Upsell, cross-sell and drive adoption of Bytedance solutions for existing customers.
Qualifications- Engineering Bachelor degree and above; - At least 1 - 3 years of related work experience, preferably AI-related or IT consultant solution & pre-sale role;- Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills, deep understanding of the AI technologies as well as Industry vertical pain points- Hands-On experience on the following technologies :  - Video/Image processing (OpenGL/C) - Web and App Software development (JS, ios, Android) - Databases, Analytics, AI.- Experience in reading/writing programming languages (Server, Web, Android/iOS Mobile App), Deep Understanding of Software development technologies, Can manage debugging and troubleshooting, Comfortable with APIs;- Knowledge in Cloud Infrastructures, Security and Compliance is a plus.- Experience in Project Management;- Data-Driven Pragmatism, critical thinking and outcome-driven;- Comfortable with fast-paced and ambiguous "startup" environment

The Video Platform team (VCOPS) in Pexip is looking for talented and ambitious engineers seeking new challenges.
Location: Hybrid mode in either our Australia or Singapore office.
Using modern technologies, development tools and cloud-based applications, our team is responsible for designing, building and maintaining distributed, massive-scale video environments across the globally distributed Pexip services, and for developing the tools and functions needed to ensure the well-being, stability and performance of these. VCOPS consists of a global team of engineers with a wide range of skill-sets within various IT/technology areas, and we are looking to expand the team with passionate individuals who are not afraid to take on challenging tasks or to step outside of their comfort zone for achieving our next goals and milestones. We have reached a million minutes of video conferencing going through the Pexip platform every hour. That's video and audio being decoded, mixed and encoded in real time on more than 4,000 virtual machines all around the world. By joining the Pexip development team you will get to impact the experience of thousands of active users and influence the core technology used by the dev team.
Candidate Qualifications
Good understanding of modern networkingExperience with modern cloud environments(Azure/GCP)Experience with Linux based environmentsExperience with Go/Python scripting would be beneficialStrong debugging, troubleshooting, and problem solving skillsSIP and WebRTC would be welcome, but not a must
Things we love
Technology driven company culture, self-organized engineering team, plenty of free food and drinks in our offices, competitive salaries and package including company shares, 3-day hackathon twice a year in the Norwegian mountains, working in a very diverse environment (18+ nationalities in our Dev team, engineers from various backgrounds: musicians, maths, physics, cinema, etc.), and much more!

About Pexip:
Pexip is a rapidly growing videoconferencing company, formed from two successful Norwegian start-ups. One company was founded in a boathouse, one in a loft, however both were established by experienced engineers who had a vision for what the right technology could do for the industry and for society. Ten years later, the world is now more ready than ever to adopt innovative communication tools and Pexip has the platform and the experience to be at the forefront of this revolution.
Pexip provides a unique approach to video communication and collaboration, allowing integration between any device via WebRTC in-browser video or mobile apps, as well as previously incompatible technologies such as in-room video conferencing systems, Microsoft Teams and Google Meet services.We sell Pexip products either as completely self-hosted software, or as a fully managed service, or a combination of both. Our customers are based all around the world, and are from a wide range of industries. Pexip has grown steadily over the past ten years and following our successful IPO in 2020 we are now investing even more in finding the right people to help us help our customers solve today’s very real collaboration problems.
Today we have over 550 people and are growing fast, but Pexip’s culture means the world to us, which is why we are focused on growing our team in the right way: the Pexip Way.The Pexip Way builds on a strong foundation of shared values. Our goal is to work together as One Team and we empower our employees with the Freedom and Responsibility to decide for themselves how to deliver on that goal. We believe that we all thrive in an environment that is both Professional and Fun and with No Bullshit - where we are honest and direct with ourselves and our customers.
Pexip is an equal opportunity employer and evaluates applicants on merit and regardless of their age, race, ethnicity, gender, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, family situation, or veteran status. We embrace diversity and believe it is integral to making Pexip unique, which is why we are so committed to creating a kind, inclusive environment for all employees.
Pexip has main development centres in Oslo, Norway and Reading, UK, along with a rapidly growing number of offices around the world.

See yourself at Twilio

Join the team as our next Technical Support Engineer!

Who We Are & Why We’re Hiring

Twilio powers real-time business communications and data solutions that help companies and developers worldwide build better applications and customer experiences.

Although we're headquartered in San Francisco, we're on a journey to becoming a globally antiracist company that supports diversity, equity & inclusion wherever we do business. We employ thousands of Twilions worldwide, and we're looking for more builders, creators, and visionaries to help fuel our growth momentum.

About The Job

Twilio is looking for Technical Support Engineers to join our Developer Support Team, supporting our customers’ use of the Twilio platform, and helping customers get the best experience from Twilio’s products. You will function as the voice of Twilio to our customers and partners, and operate as an SME for Twilio’s APIs and SDKs!

In This Role, You’ll

Responsibilities
 WEAR THE CUSTOMER’S SHOES: Use your strong technical and diplomatic skills to address customer issues and provide customer feedback to Twilio’s Product and Engineering teams.  Be ready to assist our customers when they need us. This position may require working an irregular shift, including the weekend (Shifts are subject to change based on evolving team and customer needs).  BE INCLUSIVE: Work with our customers' and partners' developers, architects, and support personnel to resolve complex problems with potentially very costly and far-reaching consequences.  BE AN OWNER: Collaborate with your teammates and the Twilio Product and Engineering teams via Slack as well as filing JIRAs to report reproducible bugs.  WRITE IT DOWN: Review and contribute to internal knowledge bases and external technical resources to stay current on industry shifts and standards. 
Qualifications

Not all applicants will have skills that match a job description exactly. Twilio values diverse experiences in other industries, and we encourage everyone who meets the required qualifications to apply. While having “desired” qualifications make for a strong candidate, we encourage applicants with alternative experiences to also apply. If your career is just starting or hasn't followed a traditional path, don't let that stop you from considering Twilio. We are always looking for people who will bring something new to the table!

Required
 Broad and deep capabilities to troubleshoot server-side code (C#, Java, Node.js, Ruby, or PHP) and client-side code (JavaScript, Android, iOS). A good understanding of OOP is necessary. Expertise with both native and mobile applications is a great bonus.  Good knowledge of RESTful technology, previous work with APIs and ability to understand and troubleshoot issues with cloud solutions.  Skills in troubleshooting network connectivity issues, with an understanding of TCP/UDP, and basics of SSL/TLS. Bonus: Understanding of WebRTC would be a HUGE plus.  High competency in communicating complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences via phone or email mediums.  Interest in utilizing customer feedback to identify and drive improvements in our products.  Ability to stand in the customer’s shoes and demonstrated dedication to the customer experience.  Advanced time management skills, ability to work well under pressure, and proficiency at developing workflows to increase troubleshooting efficiency while still following standard processes and procedures.  Excellence in task prioritization and evaluation of situational urgency.  Proficiency in Mandarin (speaking & writing) will be required for this role 
Location 

This role will be based in our Singapore/ Hong Kong office.

What We Offer

There are many benefits to working at Twilio, including, in addition to competitive pay, things like generous time-off, ample parental and wellness leave, healthcare, a retirement savings program, and much more. Offerings vary by location.

Twilio thinks big. Do you

We like to solve problems, take initiative, pitch in when needed, and are always up for trying new things. That's why we seek out colleagues who embody our values — something we call Twilio Magic . Additionally, we empower employees to build positive change in their communities by supporting their volunteering and donation efforts.

So, if you're ready to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and be the best version of yourself, apply now!

If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open positions .

jobTitle: Cloud Sales Capture - Senior Manager - SEA
jobDescription:
We are a leading partner to the world’s major cloud providers, including AWS, Azure, and Google. The formation of Accenture Cloud First, with a $3 billion investment over three years, demonstrates our commitment to deliver greater value to our clients when they need it most. Our Cloud First multi-service group of more than 70,000 cloud professionals delivers a full stack of integrated cloud capabilities across data, edge, integrated infrastructure and applications, deep ecosystem skills, the culture of change along with deep industry expertise to shape, move, build and operate our clients’ businesses in the cloud.
To accelerate our customer's transformation leveraging cloud, we combine world-class learning and talent development expertise; deep experience in cloud change management; and cloud-ready operating models with a commitment to the responsible business by design — with security, data privacy, responsible use of artificial intelligence, sustainability and ethics and compliance built into the fundamental changes Accenture helps companies achieve.
People in the Sales career track play a key role working as part of our account team to grow pipeline and sales by originating, identifying, managing and closing of sales opportunities across a range of Accenture Cloud offerings, including cloud strategy, cloud-native development, migration & modernization, and cloud managed services. They progress by deepening sales skills, developing new skills, and evolve into more complex sales roles on larger opportunities.
Successful Accenture Cloud Sales professionals have experience selling one or more of the Accenture Cloud offering areas with one or more of the major cloud providers to enterprise customers in one or multiple industries.
Overview:
The Cloud Sales Director - focused on growing Accenture Cloud First Technology Business, manages opportunities through all phases, including qualification, sales pursuit and close by applying deep sales process and offering expertise. Develop relationships with key buyers and decision-makers at new and existing clients by utilizing a differentiated roadmap and framework to enable our Client’s transformation utilizing the latest cloud-based technologies.
The Work:
Provides solutions to complex technology business problems for opportunities requiring in-depth knowledge of organizational objectives.
Interacts with senior management levels at clients and within Accenture, determines pursuit strategies, develops client messaging plans and relationships, and applies industry-leading Cloud transformation strategies and practices.
Has latitude in decision-making and determining objectives and approaches to critical assignments.
Operates within large teams and directs specific team sales activities.
Must be able to travel up to 75%
Here's what you need:
Minimum 6 years selling & closing enterprise deals in the professional services space in one or more of the following areas: Cloud enablement migration and modernization, Public Cloud managed services and Technology Services such as consulting and development services.
Minimum of 8 years’ Sales Pursuit Management experience
Minimum 4 years’ experience selling consulting services with one or more of the major cloud providers.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in direct sales with a quota of $10M+
A Bachelor's in Computer Science, Engineering or Technical Science. In lieu of a degree, twelve years of professional experience.
Bonus points if you have:
Previous experience in conceptualizing, planning, and implementing cloud migration, modernization, cloud-native development, or cloud managed services.
Industry experience in Life Sciences, State & Local Government, Oil & Gas, Utilities, Banking, Insurance, Heath, or Manufacturing.
Experience with C-Level client relationship building and relationship management.
Proven ability to operate within a team-oriented environment.
Demonstrated leadership, teamwork, and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilian.
High energy level, decisiveness, and ability to work well in demanding client environments.
Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills.
Strong leadership, problem solving, and decision-making abilities.
Unquestionable professional integrity, credibility, and character.

Are you a Cloud Security Engineer seeking your next contract opportunity in Singapore? If so RP International have the opportunity for you
The RoleRP International are working alongside a well-known business who are seeking a Cloud Security Engineer to join them on permanent. We are seeking an individual who is responsible for the engineering and management of critical cloud infrastructure and security services across the organisation 
Key SkillsExperience in administration or use of various cloud providers (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP etc.) and cloud security products such as CASB, CWPP, CSPM, CNSP etc., Key skills: Cloud Native Security, Application & Host Security, Infrastructure Defence, Cloud Security Architecture, and Vulnerability assessments, knowledge of AWS cloud security services like CloudTrail, GuardDuty, IAM etc. Knowledge of MITRE ATT & CK and Cyber Kill Chain methods with regular expressions, automation, and scripting is an assetCertifications like CISSP, AWS SA

Interested! please contact me aje@rpint.comEA Licence No: 11S2959

As a Cloud Advisor, you will be:
Leading teams involved in the delivery of enterprise wide Cloud advisory and transformation programs with Fortune 500 / FTSE 100 companies;
Working with executive-level clients to unlock new potential streams of Business Value by bringing to life a cloud-enabled enterprise transformation agenda;
Helping to define Cloud technology roadmaps and industry/functional solutions, advising senior technical clients on cloud-enabled enterprise transformation agendas;
Driving the strategic planning of our clients’ multi-year Cloud journeys with a clear industry focus across Accenture’s priority 19 industries – this includes Cloud strategy, architecture and product/service design within an industry context;
Responsible for driving the creation of the value case for the client business challenges that would most benefit from migration/transformation to AWS, Azure, GCP, Alibaba cloud providers, or hybrid cloud;
Delivering Cloud optimization services across the lifetime of a Cloud transformation journey, driving up client value across architecture, economics, engineering/security and service delivery;
Exploiting the innovation of Cloud using higher-order products (AI, IOT, Advanced Analytics, 5G), and industry/functional solutions to create new business value;
Enabling the adoption of DevSecOps and Continuous ‘everything’, with a new workforce and operating model underpinned by enterprise change management;
Building and applying technical, industry, and functional knowledge to support efforts in selling opportunities to both existing and new clients;
Partnering more broadly with our Accenture capabilities in Technology, Interactive, our Amazon, Microsoft, Google, Oracle and Alibaba Business Groups (‘AxBGs’), and the hyperscalers (‘MAAGs’) themselves to enable the delivery of multi-year Cloud and Technology transformation programs
Job Requirements
Grow Accenture’s business. Find and create business opportunities across multiple entities and geographies within developed and emerging client organizations. Foster a culture of entrepreneurship. Develop and codify intellectual capital and points of view and create distinctive knowledge initiatives that result in significant client impact and strengthen the Accenture TS&A Cloud external reputation.
Develop client relationships. Pursue and cultivate trusted advisor relationships with CSuite, business unit, and division head levels at the most critical clients in order to drive client value. Lead, develop and engage the Accenture TS&A resources for the client to identify and drive value; collaborate with industry and client account leadership to drive the Accenture TS&A point of view; ensure delivery expectations are met and resolve open issues related to Accenture TS&A sales and delivery; and bring the best Accenture resources to the client.
Create and implement innovative solutions. Identify the issues that CIOs are, and should be, concerned with and mobilize efforts to address these issues and frame alternative approaches to resolution. Understand current and future client needs in the context of market dynamics, and apply insights to recommend short- and/or long term value creation for the client at the C-Suite, business unit and division head levels that has the appropriate level of impact. Ensure the quality of the work to be truly distinctive in its focus on client impact and tangible results.
Develop and engage Accenture’s people and practice. Inspire people to develop a deep understanding of the client industry, operations, issues and strategic alternatives, and create a distinctive brand experience clients associate with Accenture. Act as a people and client leader, developing leaders beneath you, peers, clients and colleagues.
Partner-level management consulting experience.
Minimum of 16-20 years client/market experience in Cloud, enterprise architecture, data, and New IT operating models with a demonstrated record of successful, new business generation, and client leadership across a broad client portfolio. Candidates will currently be in Leadership positions within:
A Technology strategy consulting/advisory firm including audit-consulting or strategy houses;
Global technology services firm or niche mid-scale Cloud engineering/delivery and advisory firm;
Senior industry position focused recently on Cloud transformation.
Clear understanding of Business and Technology strategy and delivery within 1-3 key industries.
Deep understanding of the dynamics in technology organization/the CIO’s domain and the business/Line of Business areas served.
Knowledge and utilization of technology and digital solutions for clients.
Demonstrated ability to link business strategy expertise with operational know-how and understanding of technology to drive leading digital solutions and positioning for clients.
Strong rolodex of senior executives.
Extensive relationships at senior levels across key Accenture markets: North America, Europe and Growth Markets.
Educational pedigree.
Bachelor’s degree from a top-tier university is required; advanced degree, such as an M.B.A., is preferred. Certifications across AWS, MSFT, GCP and Alibaba advised. Broader Computer Science and Cloud/Data certifications and academic experience will also strengthen candidacy.
Critical Leadership Capabilities
Collaborating and Influencing
Negotiates with a genuine give-and-take approach, where both act as true peers and decisions are shared.
Spends time identifying all stakeholders necessary and meets or connects with all of them, neglecting no one to shape a collective consensus.
Identifies opportunities to build relationships that will help others achieve their objectives and reaches out to those people or new people.
Leading People
Collaborates and openly debates with the team to manage projects, solve problems, discuss challenging issues, or learn more about critical issues as a group.
Delegates roles thoughtfully to free self to work at a more strategic level.
Collaborates with each employee to establish clear, challenging performance goals and metrics for the year.
Designs a performance management process to monitor projects and deliver results that exceed expectations.
Periodically reviews team progress against plans, focuses attention beyond the project to the full year or more.
Managing Customers
Seeks regular customer feedback and distinguishes patterns specific to categories of customers or other segments, validating with regular customer data-gathering.
Tailors responses to customers based on specific patterns of differences, revises approach for each customer.

jobTitle: Senior Software Engineer, IT – Digital Affinity (Customer)
jobDescription:
Job Purpose

We are seeking a Senior Software Developer, who will be part of Digital Affinity mobile application development team. The successful candidate is one who has deep understanding of the mobile application architecture & design, micro-services architecture and API principles. He/she is passionate about software development and can develop mobile applications in accordance with best practice design principles. 

The Job

 Contribute to the mobile application architecture and design. Understand and implement feature/user stories. Participate in the coding together with the application development team. Build Deployment modules and pipelines for SIT, UAT, and Production. Practice good test-driven development. Plan & collaborate across different domain application teams to manage technical and security related dependencies of the solution. Plan, monitor and manage risks/issues related to technical application delivery and to provide L3 support as needed. Partner with Test Manager/Testers to ensure completion of SIT, UAT, Non-Functional Testing and Application Security Testing with quality outcomes. Act as a subject matter expert in the web / mobile application space and constantly keep up with knowledge of new concepts, emerging technology, and architecture. Problem solver with ability to see things in multiple angles, and constantly push boundaries to improve status quo. You are expected to interact with specialist teams like security, compliance and facilitate workshops/meetings to resolve issues. Escalate issues that impacts project schedule on timely basis and propose workarounds/resolutions. 

 Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks. Maintains awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company. Highlights any potential concerns /risks and proactively shares best risk management practices.

At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.

 Work you’ll do 

Cloud is transforming the way technology enables the business. It represents a radical shift in how IT services are obtained, used, and managed. Companies are navigating through the various cloud options and deciding between private, public, or a combination across different and dynamic provider ecosystems. Our cloud specialists guide our clients through multi-year journeys from the case for change through implementation across all dimensions of cloud - business alignment, technology architecture and design, cloud application on-boarding, and transforming their operating model – to help solve our client’s most complex issues with the focus on value creation.

Our practitioners work collaboratively within integrated, cross-functional teams to deliver comprehensive strategies that enable Cloud and Infrastructure transformations. Teamwork is crucial as teams are composed of a diverse group of specialists across multiple disciplines from both within our consulting practice and from our clients, helping drive towards a successful outcome. Our practitioners are expected to own and deliver their respective deliverables while managing different clients and other stakeholders.

In partnership with other leaders in the firm, you will focus on selling and delivering cloud solutions using AWS. As Cloud Architect, you will you will drive the design and delivery of world-class cloud solutions for our clients, providing expertise on cloud infrastructure services including design, build and migrate. This includes taking a lead role in the cloud architecture and engineering practice. You will be challenged to find approaches that enable rapid adoption of new cloud services and drive transformation for our client’s business and IT processes.
 Promote public cloud internally to sales and delivery teams to drive growth.  Be the go to person for Cloud Network engineering. You should have a deep understanding and hands on experience of services offered on Public Cloud platforms and understand how to configure these services to support the building of complex solutions.  Support the solution architects, and delivery teams in design, build, configuration, testing and deployment on Public Cloud  Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the Public Cloud solutions architect community  Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within customers to enable them to be cloud advocates, and provide advisory around integration of on-premises environments with Public Cloud  Act as a technical liaison between customers, delivery teams and support. 
 Your role as a leader 

At Deloitte, we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. We expect our people to embrace and live our purpose and shared values, challenging themselves every day to identify issues that are most important to our clients, our people and the communities, and to make an impact that matters. In addition to living our purpose, Senior Managers across our Firm are expected to:
 Establish a strong leadership brand by inspiring others through passion, integrity, and appreciation.  Create opportunities to drive impact by leveraging each person’s strengths to build high performing teams.  Apply deep knowledge of trends and activity to drive continuous improvement and build lasting relationships across a diverse network.  Translate and communicate broader strategy into a convincing team vision and goals, in order to align the team and sets priorities to achieve objectives.  Actively contribute to building the talent pipeline by championing a talent experience that attracts, develops and retains top talent and high performing teams. 
Enough About Us, Let's Talk About You

If you are someone with:
 A good honors Degree, preferably at postgraduate level, in Information Technology, Business Information Systems, Business, Engineering, Mathematics or related disciplines.  The right person will be detailed, highly technical, having 12+ years of current solution architecture experience, including consulting and implementation for hybrid, and non-hybrid solutions, with 2 years in a leadership role. Demonstrated experience in an enterprise environment, and experience with AWS is an advantage  The candidate is AWS Certified and will have a thorough understanding, familiarity and experience with Amazon Web Services. They will keep themselves up to date with the latest and greatest developments in the Public Cloud arena, and should have a thorough and deep understanding of key differentiators between Amazon Web Services and competing offerings from Azure, GCP etc.  Experience in the establishment of an automated DevOps release management pipeline which delivers tooling for next generation application development efforts (the Dev) and on-going production operations (the Ops).  A thorough and in-depth understanding of Container based architectures  Experience architecting infrastructure solutions (preferably on Amazon Web Services) using both Linux/Unix and Windows with specific recommendations on server, load balancing, HA/DR, & storage architectures  Experience with deploying cloud based solutions and workload migration strategy using tools  6+ years architecting, implementing and supporting Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services infrastructure and topologies  Experience with Enterprise application and database architecture  Understanding of Agile, SCRUM and Continuous Delivery  Demonstrated skills in communication (oral, written, presentation), analysis, problem solving and short term and long term planning  Experienced, persuasive and effective presenter, both written and verbal  Demonstrated skills in leadership, communication, coaching, analysis, problem solving and short term and long term planning  Knowledge of standard selling disciplines, specifically Solution Selling and RFP management  Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills, ability to handle diverse situations, multiple initiatives and rapidly changing priorities  Willingness to work outside of office base and most of all…  An appreciation of the consulting lifestyle and ability to travel (both locally and abroad) is a pre-requisite to fit to our short-term and long-term project assignment. 
 Next Steps 

So what are you waiting for? Join the winning team now.

 Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Versent is an Australian-born technology company, focused on architecting, building & operating cloud native applications, data streams, platforms and services.

Our solutions are centred around AWS and best of breed technology. From a stand-still start in 2014, we've grown to over 500 Versentonians in just eight years across Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide, Perth, Brisbane, Singapore and now Denver.

With a diversified offering in professional services, managed services and product, we are poised for significant growth in 2022.

The key purpose of the Practice Director role for a region is to lead growth and solution conversations with customers as well as software partners from a subject matter and experience base. In the role and you will be in charge of shaping solutions and delivering early stage executive consulting outcomes related to all things cloud adoption across new and key strategic accounts.

This is achieved through your deep subject matter expertise and experience in the Cloud and/or Application Development space with major providers. With capability to understand Digital, Data and Security subject matter supported by dedicated SMEs. This role is accountable for working closely with software partners, client deal and delivery teams to develop the solution for all client engagements and supporting pre-sales to delivery handover. You will also be a credible subject matter expert partner in the sales process and will drive Versent’s growth strategy through effective client engagement, advisory and successful solutions. Ensuring that the capability and solutions model the nears of the industry.

To Be Successful, You Will Have
Experience in a customer-facing, sales-aligned role such as Consultant, Solutions Engineer or Solutions ArchitectGains clear agreement and commitment from others by persuading, convincing and negotiatingHigh level of technical and analytical knowledge in the relevant Cloud and proven experience in engineering and software architecture designAnalyses information for greater understanding of a problem to provide workable solutions and make rational judgements to a problemWork strategically to realise organisational goals and take into account a wide range of issues across and related to the organisationAbility to influence the discussion with clients and demonstrate how business outcomes can be achieved with recommended solutionsComprehension of coding languages, cloud concepts, modern technology approaches, delivery practices and organisation capabilityFocusing on customer needs and satisfaction by setting high standards for quality & throughput, monitoring & maintaining productivity, working systematically & consistently achieving project goalsApplies specialist and detailed technical expertise and shares knowledge with others
Our Culture

No cool cliques, just motivated passionate humans generating ideas and devising solutions in a creative, collaborative workspace. We're building a team and looking for people who can think outside the square and deliver what others might consider impossible.

At Versent, we embrace the notion of Family: working together to achieve outstanding success.

What We Offer You

At Versent we invest in our people, with benefits such as:
 Competitive salary package. Working in a flexible, outcome-driven environment. Outside of client obligations, you can work from the office or home as needed. Also, leave the suit and tie behind and put on a Versent T-shirt instead. Weekly internal tech talks; all streamed and recorded so those who can’t make it to the office can still participate. For those who do make it, there’s pizza, beer, wine and soft drinks on tap. Regular social events, meetups and guest speakers organised and facilitated by our team. A supportive family culture. If you need help, just ask. Celebration of the wins – big or small, because we know how hard you work.
And finally, we believe that every human is equal, across every dimension, and we function as an unbiased meritocracy. We strive to have Inclusion front and centre in how we operate and embed the fundamentals of tolerance and understanding in everything we do. This core belief is woven into all our policies.

Curious? Here is more about us – but honestly, we are more interested in you!

 Single‐point‐of‐contact for Infrastructure team for all new system initiatives;  Understand systems operations environment and drive Infrastructure Review Processes;  Manage infrastructure services to support systems environments;  Ensure assigned projects are completed within the agreed timeline and resources;  Monitoring and reviewing own performance to achieve targets and dead‐line;  Assist the team in design, planning, management, maintenance and support of cloud infrastructure for high traffic workloads that operate at enterprise scale;  Research and implement technology solutions to improve the performance, reliability, availability, security and efficiency of infrastructure  Identify risks (infrastructure, network, security) early and ensure they are addressed before they become actual problems;  Setup, testing and implementation of technologies on multiple cloud environments  Automate tasks and implement infrastructure services;  Day-to-day monitoring, configuring, backup, and maintenance of systems cloud environment to optimal performance.

 Must have at least 3 ‐ 5 years of working experience in Cloud/OnPrem IT infrastructure  Advance knowledge and experience for IT infrastructure (Cloud ‐ Azure, AWS, M365, Cisco Cloud Security, Citrix VDI | On Prem ‐ Wintel Server, Linux and PC)  Good verbal and written communication and presentation, negotiation skill in English, Japanese (Optional)  Hands‐on individual contributor and be able to lead and guide vendor, and work with local and offshore team  Good technical knowledge of application infrastructure technologies as primary practice area, with knowledge in supporting technologies driving daily infrastructure operations.  Project manager with positive attitude, technical, creative, and able to work under pressure and independently.  Should have sense of ownership, urgency and self‐motivation  Able to travel on short notice according to requirements  Cloud Knowledge ‐ Azure, AWS, M365, Cisco Cloud Security, Citrix VDI (Advanced level knowledge)  Cloud Migration & Planning knowledge ‐ Azure, AWS (Advanced level knowledge)  Hardware knowledge ‐ HPE Server, Storage | Dell Server, Storage (Advanced level knowledge)  Microsoft Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019 platform Technologies (Advanced level knowledge)  Virtualization Technologies (VMware, Hyper‐V) (Advanced level knowledge)  Backup Technologies (Veeam & Symantec) (Advanced level knowledge)  Microsoft Windows PC OS 10 platform Technologies (Advanced level knowledge)  Microsoft SQL Database (Advanced level knowledge)  Oracle Database management (Advanced level knowledge)  Project management skill ‐ Planning, budget, schedule, risk, issue management (Advanced level knowledge)  Network Routing / SD WAN / Firewall Policy (Administration level knowledge)  AWS Certified with Solution Architect Associate or Professional is required  Azure Certified with Administrator Associate or Solution Architect Expert is preferred. 

Benefits

Working Location: Singapore

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

As a Data Engineer, you will be building Whole-of-Government data infrastructure to power the insights needed for evidence-based decision-making and enhancing agencies’ service-delivery. You will be architecting, designing and building next-generation data infrastructure to galvanise digitalisation in the public sector.

We are looking for enthusiastic and passionate engineers to join us in this journey to make a difference.

 What you will be working on: 
 Design and build resilient and efficient data pipelines for both batch and real-time streaming data Architect and design data infrastructure on cloud using industry standard Infrastructure-as-Code tools Execute projects with an Agile mindset Build software frameworks to solve data problems at scale Collaborate with product managers, software engineers, data analysts and data scientists to build scalable and data-driven platforms and tools

 What we are looking for: 
 Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or have equivalent professional experience Experience with data processing tools such as Spark, Beam, Flink Experience with the cloud (e.g. AWS, GCP, Azure) Experience implementing batch and streaming data pipelines Experience writing efficient SQL In-depth knowledge of both SQL and NoSQL databases, including performance tuning and troubleshooting Familiar with DevOps tools such as Git, Docker, Terraform Experience in the public sector is a bonus

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round.
Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

About Datadog:

Datadog is the monitoring and security platform for cloud applications. Our SaaS product is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries to enable digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stack, allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally. Given the resilience of cloud technologies and importance placed today in digital operations and agility, Datadog continues to innovate and is well positioned for the long term.

The Team:

We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The technical solutions team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. We share our technical and product expertise with customers through demos, presentations, technical evaluations, and ongoing support. Technical solutions is a growing global team that collaborates constantly to share knowledge and continuously advance our technical skill set.

The Opportunity:

Join a diverse team of traditional and non-traditional backgrounds, working together to solve hard problems the right way. You’ll be joining a team and company immersed in a startup-like environment where you will be challenged, but also will immediately witness your contributions to Datadog.

You Will:
Respond to client requests on our fast paced team while continuing to educate our clients on the use of the platformReproduce issues and dive into the 400+ integrations that Datadog works withBuild out documentation and knowledge based articles for a variety of technologyDrive product conversations based on needs and problems learned during client interactions

You Are:
Self-motivated, detail-attentive, and have a desire for continuous learning A critical thinker who defaults to a client-centric approachA tinkerer with some programming experience and a basic knowledge of LinuxA master at one thing: tell us all about itAble to work a rotating schedule that requires weekend availability

Bonus Points:
CS or Engineering majorsActive contribution to open-source projects (code, bug reports, etc.) and the Engineering Community (Meetups, etc.)You want to start your own company someday

Why You Should Apply:
Generous and competitive global benefitsNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase planContinuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and spaceBest in breed onboardingInternal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentallyFriendly and inclusive workplace culture

Equal Opportunity at Datadog:

Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Your Privacy:

Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

That’s why many of the world’s largest organizations trust Dynatrace®️ to modernize and automate cloud operations, release better software faster, and deliver unrivalled digital experiences.

We are looking for a Data Analyst who will assist Customer Success Managers, Sales Operations, Deal Desk Renewal Specialists and Account Executives by pulling renewal data and crafting into reality a system derived proposal with the details requested.
