Preferably certified and has strong operational knowledge in AWS, Google, IBM Cloud or Microsoft Azure cloud platform.Preferably has past Business-to-Business (B2B) projects for web and mobile applications
Personal Characteristics & Behaviours:Have an open mindset and is receptive to learning new thingsInterested to stay on top of technologies to facilitate vendors management for delivery and acceptance for hardware, software, and other cloud technologies.Good with technical troubleshooting in fast paced environment and has strong work ethics.Technically inclined and takes lead on technology improvements and innovations.Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skillsRight balance of technical, analytical and communication skillsStrong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholdersGood time-management skills with track record of following through on commitments

Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.

About the Role:

Elastic Cloud is a fully managed service for the Elastic Stack, Security, Observability, and Enterprise Search solutions, and we are looking for a Technical Lead to guide our User Growth team.

Our service is operated at planet scale - across major Cloud providers in 50 plus regions across the world, hosting mission critical workloads for thousands of customers in every industry! The User Growth team is a full stack team of engineers that is responsible for enabling product-led growth - discoverability of our product, conversion, expansion and retention. Our team works hard to reduce friction through our users journey and provide onboarding experiences that showcases the value of the Elastic platform. You will have front-row seats in supporting the high growth of a SaaS product and the opportunity to work in an impactful, cross-team setting!

What You Will Be Doing:
Guide technical design and architecture for a team of 10 backend and frontend engineers.Spend time reviewing and writing design documents, reviewing Pull Requests and exploring new implementation ideas.Use A/B testing to get feedback on critical changes that impacts our critical user flows.Partner with engineering teams from AWS, GCP and Azure to integrate natively into their control planes, messaging and analytical services.Be a "player/mentor" for the team, getting your hands into code and design where required.Foster a culture of mutual respect and collaborative decision-making.Improve engineering standards, tooling, and processes.
What You Bring Along:
In-Depth knowledge developing and leading software development for 10-12 years.You care deeply about the resiliency of the services and quality of the features your team ships.Experience developing elegant, easy to use APIs for internal and external consumption.Experience working with any of public Cloud providers: Azure, GCP or AWS.Experience delivering high quality code, preferably in Java or Scala.You can provide pragmatic technical leadership for a group of fast moving engineers.Lead by example - you can code when needed, review PRs and stay close to the team’s work.Excellent written and verbal communication.Ego-free attitude — we are here for the success of the team and the company.
What Would Be A Great Addition:
User of Elasticsearch - understand data modeling, aggregations and querying capabilities.Experience in user identity management and SSO.
Additional Information - We Take Care Of Our People

As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.
Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Health coverage for you and your family in many locationsAbility to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many rolesGenerous number of vacation days each yearDouble your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you loveEmbracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave

jobTitle: Head of Cloud and Enterprise Systems
jobDescription:
Job Description



 Overall Purpose Of The Job
The primary role of Head of Cloud and Enterprise Systems Infrastructure is to support technology-enabled business strategies and operations to drive increased agility, scalability, and improve service quality of the Technology Operations, Infrastructure and Cloud team. The role is accountable for the development of processes to manage Cloud and Enterprise systems operations, assist in technical standards development, assist in architecture development, leadership and employee development.

As a senior leadership position, this role is responsible for the hands on Technology and Business services for operations and delivery of Cloud and Enterprise Systems offerings. The role will collaborate with Engineering, Architecture, Application Development, Business partners, Corporate Systems, venders / service providers, and various infrastructure and operations groups to create and support an operational environment for new and existing services supported by Cloud Infrastructure.

The right candidate earns trust through outstanding performance, effective communication skills, and a strong record of delivering results timely and effectively. You should have experience managing complex programs. The ideal candidate has broad technical skills, strong financial acumen, IT operations experience, and a deep analytical background. Strong judgement and a demonstrated ability to influence without explicit authority are key to success.



 Key Responsibilities
The scope of responsibilities Includes the following

Overall responsibility for the day-to-day operations of managing Cloud Services and Enterprise Systems (Linux, AIX and Microsoft) including software deployment and upgrades, system setup, system administration, monitoring, incident resolution, problem management, configuration and change management, service desk, security management and monitoring, capacity planning, availability management, disaster recovery and routine update of services Ensures timely liaison with vendors regarding problems, fixes, and required enhancements Creates and maintains strategies related to Cloud Infrastructure and Cloud Services (AWS, Azure and Google) throughout the enterprise ensuring all performance and cost curves are closely managed Drives the adoption, and articulate the risks/opportunities from leveraging Cloud Infrastructure Analyze the cloud infrastructure and provide financial updates and optimization recommendationsCreate metrics, reports, and recommended remediation options and plans for financial excellence in the cloudOversees and directs the timely evaluation, qualification, and implementation of new software products, tools, and related appliances as it pertains to the Cloud environmentFive years or more of IT Service Management, data center, server, and storage management, virtualization, Citrix, networking, systems management, and/or project management is preferred Professional with experience leading large complex enterprise-wide infrastructure projects/programs with multiple interfaces and/or 3rd parties Experience supporting DevOps automation teams using tools such as Chef, Knife, Jenkins, Openstack Heat(HOT)3rd party Cloud and CDN Provider Experience: AWS, Azure, Akamai, Rackspace, and/or IBM-Softlayer Standard Infrastructure Experience: Monitoring, DNS, DHCP, Backups, and Disaster Recovery 5+ years’ experience working as an Operations Manager with demonstrated success in operating mission critical enterprise software services. Experience launching new services and teams a plusWorking with large scale networks, compute and storage architectures and assisting Tech Infra & Ops team and other Solution Architects devise best practices.Facilitate teams to critically review current processes for effectiveness, quality and simplification.Develop and implement process solutions to improve operational efficiency.


 Job Profile
Required Skills And Knowledge

BA/BS degree or equivalent experience;Familiarity with common enterprise services (Directory Services, Information Assurance, Virtual Desktop, etc.), products (i.e., Oracle, SAP) and frameworks (ITIL, Zachman, TOGAF, etc.)Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on public Cloud AWSStrong Experience and working Knowledge working in AWS Cloud Environment such as VPC, Direct Connect, IAM, S3, EC2,EKS, Tagging, Cloud Monitoring, Config, CloudTrail, Lambda, ECS, CDN, Route53, Storage Gateway etc.Experience migrating or transforming legacy business/ customer solutions to the cloudHighly technical and analytical, possessing 10 or more years of progressive technology implementation and operational experienceDeep knowledge of information technology infrastructure domains such as compute server platforms, storage server platforms, server components, network devices, technologies and architectures, IT service delivery principles and best practicesOutstanding customer relationship management, operations, delivery experience and collaboration skillsDemonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challengesConsulting practice leadershipDeep understanding of infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS) cloud computing operations and transitionEnterprise architecture successes including virtualization technologies & distributed architectureFamiliarity with archive, disaster recovery and business continuity in global operationsFamiliarity with compliance & security standards across the enterprise IT landscapeExperience with open-source technology based infrastructure and deployment orchestration solutions, e.g., OpenStack, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker, etc.
Required Competencies

Effective communicator at all levels of the organisation and outside with third partiesFamiliarity with project management approaches, tools and phases of the project lifecycle.Exceptional communication skills – both written and verbal. Ability to be personable and tenacious as the situations requiresAble to work effectively at all levels in an organization. Excellent active listening skills. Problem solving and root cause identification skills. Strong analytic and decision-making abilities. Must be a team player and able to work with and through others. Ability to influence others and move toward a common vision or goal.Ability to work in a multicultural and international environmentIntegrity & Self Development (live up to commitments; seek feedback to enhance
performance; deal constructively with own mistakes).

User/customer focusedAble to coach and mentor direct team members and extended team members
Required Qualifications (Brief description of the educational background needed to perform the job)Degree in IT or equivalent Professional certifications such asIT Service Management (ITIL) best practicesCloud certification (AWS, Google, Azure)Agile / DevOpTechnical certification

About Us

Ready to build? So are we. Come join VMware’s exciting Modern Applications Business Unit (MAPBU) Team, made up of products and services under the Tanzu portfolio to help customers build, run and manage their most important applications. We build applications with velocity to run in a cloud-native environment, run Kubernetes and Cloud Foundry with consistency, and manage our customers’ entire footprint with confidence to help them achieve their business outcomes. To learn more about Tanzu watch this video. #TeamTanzu

About You

You are unique: as an exceptional, passionate, customer facing, hands-on Solution Architect you will help customers transform to realize the benefits of modern applications and architectures on the VMware Tanzu portfolio. You will also work closely with the Tanzu engineering and Solution Engineer (SE) teams to transform the way our customers build and run their software. You are a problem solver and the thought of collaborating with a team to help companies transform to meet the challenges of tomorrow excites you.

The Team

At VMware we believe that Kubernetes, and by extension Modern Applications, will transform the next generation of enterprise infrastructure and applications the way Virtualisation and Java have in the past. Customers are looking to containers to avoid lock in with public clouds and the industry has aligned around Kubernetes as the orchestration engine for these containers. The complete Tanzu portfolio consists of products and services that transform how enterprises build and operate modern applications on Kubernetes. The Platform Services team helps customers derive the value of Tanzu technology to deliver the benefits of container application platforms through DevSecOps.

What You’ll Be Doing:

Executing on customer engagements both as a member of a team for complex engagements and solo for engagements Driving platform adoption by working with application teams to embrace modern practices around developer workflow, application enhancements, build and packaging, application lifecycle, and observabilityDeploying and operationalising platforms built on Kubernetes by designing for storage integration, container networking, service routing, observability, and platform security Promote the adoption of automation techniques and DevSecOps practices to improve the infrastructure and software life cycle including infrastructure and application uptime, availability, and time-to-market Participate in mentoring and knowledge transfer to your customers Support a written culture and contribute to our technical content library Serve as an effective member of the broader Open Source and Modern Applications ecosystem, contributing to Kubernetes SIG’s, Meetups and similar Work effectively with a remote and distributed team 

Required Skills / Experience

2+ years’ experience with design and implementation of distributed systems architectures on private or public cloud infrastructure 2+ years of experience designing container-based solutions and DevOps 5+ years of experience in consulting, pre-sales function. Robust proficiency in Linux & CLI with 3+ years of experience in VM infrastructure Understanding of the latest cloud trends and best practices, including Cloud-Native, DevSecOps and infrastructure-as-code principles Experience in a customer-facing capacity, support, or consulting role Strong written and oral communication skills Ability to travel approximately 50% 

PREFERRED Or HELPFUL SKILLS / EXPERIENCE

Experience presenting to small and large audiences (Executives, Management & Developers) Experience with cloud service provider offerings like Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Google Cloud Platform (GCP) The ideal candidate will have familiarity with virtualisation technologies such as Hyper-V, vSphere, and vCenter. It would be crucial if you had experience implementing a continuous integration (CI) or continuous development (CD) pipeline.

Purpose of the roleAs Regional Head of Cloud, your role is to help potential and existing customers leverage the power of the Public Clouds (AWS, GCP, and Azure) through strong presales and solutions architecture experience. You will help govern a portfolio of accounts and act as a key driver of the delivery lifecycle, bringing executive expertise to remove barriers and successfully deliver customer business outcomes. This role is a key Services role in bringing innovative solutions and market trends to customers and developing strong partnerships with many other roles across the Sales and Delivery landscape. Key Responsibilities
This role will be responsible for external outreach and engagement with C-Level executives across a diverse geo and to influence strategic solution development and deployment that unifies cloud into unique and differentiated offerings to support APAC Services' revenue growth and adoption/utilization targets.
More specifically, the role will be responsible for engaging with top APAC customers, demonstrating and validating the value of digitized journey services, and identifying necessary deployment and utilization requirements to ensure customer success. The role will help serve as the technology advisor to APAC Services Leadership and will be responsible for detailed engagements across the area to ensure customer requirements and needs are met.
Other than above, this role will be responsible for maintaining relationships with various cloud and technology partners. Coverage is not limited to Singapore, Malaysia, and Hong Kong.
Competencies
Public cloud providers (AWS/ MS Azure/ GCP, etc.) certifications - Professional or equivalentITIL CertificationsAble to Communicate well With Technical and non-Technical C-Suite.Have broad understanding of technology and be able to productize it.Excellent working experience with cloud technology and providers such as MS Azure, GCP, Ali Cloud, Tencent Cloud, etc.
Qualifications & ExperienceCompulsory Skills
Champion Cloud's technology vision, strategy, and capabilities across Digital Transformation solutions.Serve as the go-to voice of field into for product insights and customer escalations and to scale through others across a diverse geo.Drive strategic wins and deployments by helping customers leverage public cloud services to drive Digital Transformation.Uncover and unlock strategic sales by engaging in technology workshops and executive briefings with strategic customers.Mentor Area and Domain Architects whilst growing the Services Solution Architecture Community. Experience with all pillars of Best Cloud Architecture frameworks – security, cost optimization, performance, operations, reliabilityServe as the point of escalation on critical technical solution issues and proactively represent customer requirements in product feedback and planning processes.Participate alongside the team in Opportunity management by establishing a healthy pipeline to drive & win solutions/design in line with Cloud Services strategy. Delivers against a Practice plan, ensuring that predictable and healthy business results are achieved.Customer facing experience including presenting solutions to various audience – business owners, C level, and technical teams.Experience with building a Cloud solutions program. Be able to articulate what worked and what didn’t work.Experience in Cloud Security specifically with SDLC and public\hybrid cloud.Experience building/selling a cloud Managed Services practice.Ability to be well-versed in cloud technologies, modern engineering, software development techniques and methods.Experience with migrating and running production applications in public cloud environments with hands on experience.
Fundamental Requirements
BS\MS degree in Engineering or Computer Science.Expected travel up to 20-30% per month.Must possess strong leadership skills.
Soft Skills

jobDescription:
The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

Government Infrastructure Group (GIG)

The Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) is responsible for digital infrastructure that supports the Whole-of-Government (WOG). We are the infrastructure architects and engineers who architect, design and deliver an agile, secure and sustainable infrastructure which enables a digital government for Singapore.

How We Work

Aside from formulating the infrastructure strategy and roadmap at WOG level, we also develop prototypes using new technologies and establish standards and best practices to guide the design and implementation of information systems that support the enterprise infrastructure.

We examine factors such as people, culture, policies and processes to provide a secure, predictive and always-on platform, enabling public officers to work anywhere and anytime.

By leveraging on innovative Cloud and Saas technologies, we architect, design, build and deliver Cloud and Datacentre hosting environments and common services which support government agencies in accelerating and developing modern applications and services.

Transforming ICT infrastructure through modernisation and automation is also our key focus. Using latest technology and best practices, we deliver secure and utility-based services to WOG, so that government agencies can function efficiently and seamlessly.

We are also passionate about building and uplifting ICT engineering know-how for the WOG in critical infrastructure domains, which we advance through experimentation, prototype development, consultancy and training.

Job Overview

As a  Infrastructure Engineer you will be part of team to implement and manage the Whole-of-Government (WOG) Infrastructure and services, focusing on endpoint and end-user computing (EUC) services. You will work within a team of engineers with strong technical competency to conceptualise, implement and manage the Government infrastructure services and ensuring high levels of availability, performance and security across the Whole-of-Government (WOG).

You will also collaborate with peers from other disciplines such as software developers, data engineers, UX Designers and Product Managers to design, develop and implement infrastructure products for WOG.

 What you will be working on: Design, develop, test, implement and operate the proposed endpoint and EUC services.Lead and work with service providers and product principals to manage the endpoint services and ensure efficient operations management and timely incident and problem resolution.Work closely with the infrastructure architects to rationalise the technical design and ensure the solution works well with Government infrastructure, policies, standards and security requirements.Translate the technical solution/design into technical specifications and functional requirements.Lead and work with outsourced service providers and product principals to manage the delivery, operations as well as Tech Refresh for endpoint services such as:Unified Endpoint Management (UEM)Light touch device enrolment (eg, Windows Autopilot, Android Zero Tech, Samsung Knox Mobile Enrolment [KME]Windows Hello for Business for password-less loginEndpoint monitoring and analyticsDigital Experience Management (DEM)Software deployment using MECM and IntuneAzure Conditional AccessEndpoint Detection and Response (EDR)Advanced Threat Protection (ATP)Data Loss Protection (DLP)Assess the usability of finished infrastructure designs through user testing and feedback, and continually improve infrastructure to enhance user experience.Ensure the operations process and controls are clearly documented and operationalised.Explore new solutions and technologies, integrate learning and recommendations for operational efficiency and continual improve of the infrastructure for better user experience.Plan, design and support Technology Refresh and migration activities for the infrastructure services.Ensure smooth service delivery and implementation within the business context.

 What we are looking for: At least 2 years of experience in the above domain areasProven planning, implementation and migration experience on endpoint or EUC servicesTeam player with strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.Knowledge in SCRUM or DevOps.Knowledge of ITIL processes and procedures.PowerShell scripting is a bonus.Possess the following soft skills and attributes:Ability to justify new initiatives and recommend new initiatives to stakeholder(s)Conceptualise the Concept of Operations for the new initiativesFamiliar with tendering process, defining requirements in tender specificationTeam player and able to lead discussions between internal teams (Operations, Security, Contract) and external product principals or system integratorRequires minimal supervision from supervisorAlways keeping up to date of the latest product roadmap and best practicesDefine policies and procedures related to Endpoint Management.Good written and verbal communication, with the ability to present and communicate effectively with non-technical audience.Provide inputs to optimise and automate workflows and processesAble to work independently and as a good team player with analytical, management and planning skillsDynamic and with good analytical/conceptual thinking and problem-solving skills.
Preferred Certification/Skills
Certification in Networking and Azure fundamentalsCertification in ITIL foundationCertification in device management service such as Intune, etc

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round.

Acronis is dedicated not just to cyber protection but to the general protection of its potential and current employees, interviews are being held virtually during the current global COVID-19 situation. 

Acronis is a world leader in cyber protection—empowering people by providing them with cutting-edge technology that enables them to monitor, control, and protect the data that their businesses and lives depend on. We are in an exciting phase of growth and expansion and looking for a Cloud Partner Success Manager (PSM) who is ready to join us in creating a #CyberFit future and protecting the digital world!

As the Cloud Partner Success Manager you will bring experience in Account Management and have a passion for Data Protection and Cyber Security. You will work as part of the Inside Sales Channel Management organization and aligned with a portfolio of service providers utilizing Acronis Cyber Protect Cloud. Your main goals as the Cloud PSM will be to drive drive Annual Recurrent Revenue growth through account planning with dedicated partners, increase adoption of new services, retain a partner and create a best in class partner experience which is the key differentiator of Acronis.

Like every member of our “A-Team”, the Cloud PSM has an instrumental role and impact on the success of Acronis’ innovative and growing business, so we are looking for a highly-motivated individual with a positive attitude who thrives in a fast-paced, rapidly-changing and global work environment.

What You'll Do
Make a territory analysis and planning for dedicated geographies to identify top potential partners.Align with Acronis Cloud Distributors for joint activities for channel enablementActivate and enable new partners with Acronis sales and marketing tools and programsDrive successful upsell \ cross sell initiatives to partnerMake partners sell Acronis services to existing customer base of the partner, attract new customers to partner and help to retain existing customer to partnerTrain new partners with existing and new productsDevelop relationship with key decision makers on partner sideSupport new partners on daily basis on business and technology developmentEngage Acronis presales and Technical support teamsKey KPIs: Total Revenue from signed partners, churn rate (% of partners leaving the program), number of Acronis services sold through the partner
What You Bring (experience & Qualifications)
Equivalent industry experienceChannel sales\ Partner account manager \ Channel development position within a software vendor, with a minimum of 5+ years sales and marketing experience in the software industryIn depth channel and field sales experience with understanding of cloud market business modelStrong presentation, communication and planning skillsNative/fluent English + any other local language
Who We Are

Acronis is revolutionizing cyber protection by integrating backup, disaster recovery, storage, next-generation anti-malware, and protection management into one solution. This all-in-one integration removes the complexity and risks associated with non-integrated solutions and offers easy, complete and reliable data protection for all workloads, applications, and systems across any environment—physical, virtual, cloud, and mobile—all at a low cost.

Founded in Singapore in 2003 and incorporated in Switzerland in 2008, Acronis is truly a global organization with more than 1,900 employees in 33 locations in 18 countries. Its solutions are trusted by more than 5.5 million consumers and 500,000 businesses, including 100% of the Fortune 1000 companies. Acronis products are available through 50,000 partners and service providers in over 150 countries in more than 30 languages. Acronis is in an exciting phase of growth and expansion, recently receiving a $250 million investment from CVC Capital Partners, bringing the total valuation to more than $2.5 billion.

Acronis is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Project Description
We are looking for a talented Cloud Native Developer proficient with building microservices on the back of Pivotal Cloud Foundry. We are looking for someone with strong experience in this area. The person would be a part of an experienced and established team working on a major rebuild of our platform.
Responsibilities
Develop software components with Microservices-based Architecture. Subject matter expert in Cloud Native, Agile, DevOps and CI/CD to all levels of management and project teams. Develop and delivery of Cloud Native Application Development. Participate and contribute actively in cloud native development and standards. Document requirements, codes and prepare reports in the software development lifecycle.
Skills
Must have
 Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent At least 5-7 years of working experience in full-stack software development. Strong knowledge of Cloud Native principles and techniques such as Microservices-based architecture/development, RESTful API development, container-based software deployment, Test Driven Developemnt, Strong Unit and integration testing skill, Spring Boot. Well versed in software system engineering principles and technologies (e.g. Agile, SCRUM, Pair Programming) Hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure Strong technical hands-on experience in Java 11+/Microservices apps with frameworks and libraries such as Spring, Hibernate, J2EE, JDBC, JMS, JMX, JUnit, GitLab, Mockito & WireMock, Rabbit MQ/Kafa messaging and Spring Cloud Stream framework. Possess critical thinking skills, combined with the ability to present clearly both verbally and in written form, Independent, motivated, reliable and organized. A team player with strong communication skill in English
Nice to have
 Experience with Agile/Scrum methodology. Self-starter who can work independently.
Languages
English: C2 Proficient

SALESFORCE MARKETING CLOUD (SFMC) TECHNICAL SPECIALIST

LOCATION: Singapore

HIRE TYPE: Full-time

EXPERIENCE:  5+ years of SFMC/Exact Target experience, 2+ years of lifecycle marketing campaigns

VERTICAL: eClerx Digital

Role Summary

As an SFMC Technical Specialist, you will be responsible for understanding and defining the data flows into and outside SFMC, build integrations across platforms with SFMC for smooth campaign flows, troubleshoot any SFMC related queries and act as point of contact for new functionality configuration. Knowledge of single sourcing and advanced Amp Scripting is going to be essential.

In addition, this role will be accountable for providing consulting services to the Marketing team and assisting them in the design of campaigns to help achieve business outcomes. You will own the delivery of multi-channel data-driven campaigns, provide proactive consulting & advice on best practice campaign design, based on your deep understanding of the available marketing technology capabilities and business outcomes the campaign needs to achieve. You will be the main liaison point between the Client and both internal & external technical teams to ensure there are no gaps in the end-to-end build process of data through to communications to the customer. In the eyes of the Client, you are their trusted stakeholder whom they can rely on to ensure campaigns are delivered on time, on target continuously helping driving incremental value to the Client’s business.

Key Responsibilities
Act as a SME for SFMC/ET related projectsBuild emails using content builder in SFMC/ETCustom coding (when required)Usage of AMP scripting for dynamic codingDevelopment knowledge of API scripting using REST and SOAP for integrationsResponsive build
Eligibility Requirements
Minimum 5+ years of experience on SFMC/ETMinimum 2+ years of experience on Lifecycle Marketing CampaignsGood knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript3-4 years of experience using AMP scripting2-3 years of Responsive HTML coding experienceShould have the knowledge of building advanced journeys [multichannel and multiwave, with data ingestion happening throughout the campaign journey]Ability to analyze the campaign requirements and suggest the type of DEs that needs to be usedNeeds to understand the database structure in order to come up with exception handling while AmpScriptingAdvanced knowledge of API based integration using REST or SOAPExtensive knowledge of Automation StudioKnowledge of API based complex flows using Journey BuilderShould be aware of either Einstein or Interaction StudioKnowledge of Ad / Social Studio is an added advantageAbility to work in a high-energy, quickly changing, and demanding environmentShould have excellent communication skills and be able to interface directly with clients and higher management. Should have excellent presentation skills and should be able to clearly communicate ideas, thoughts, and strategies. Valid work authorization in Singapore
About EClerx

eClerx provides business process management, analytics, and automation services to Fortune 2000 enterprises including some of the world's leading companies across financial services, cable and telecom, retail, fashion, media and entertainment, manufacturing, travel and leisure, software, and high-tech. Incorporated in 2000, eClerx is one of India's leading process management and data analytics companies and is today traded on both the Bombay Stock Exchange and National Stock Exchanges of India. eClerx employs 11000+ people across its global sites in the US, UK, Italy, Germany, and Singapore along with delivery centers in India and Thailand.
